commit_message:
Cleanup of mox from kuryr

Cleanup patch to remove mox

Co-Authored-By: Darla Ahlert <da741q@att.com>
Implements: bp drop-mox
Change-Id: I6b1875b6fa6dfaa7544a8cd72b23e3ca521cec1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/55/405855/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from mox3 import mox self.mox = mox.Mox() self.addCleanup(self.mox.VerifyAll) self.addCleanup(self.mox.UnsetStubs) def _mock_out_binding(self, endpoint_id, neutron_port, neutron_subnets, neutron_network=None): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(binding, 'port_bind') fake_binding_response = ( 'fake-veth', 'fake-veth_c', ('fake stdout', '')) binding.port_bind(endpoint_id, neutron_port, neutron_subnets, neutron_network).AndReturn( fake_binding_response) self.mox.ReplayAll() return fake_binding_response def _mock_out_unbinding(self, endpoint_id, neutron_port): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(binding, 'port_unbind') fake_unbinding_response = ('fake stdout', '') binding.port_unbind(endpoint_id, neutron_port).AndReturn( fake_unbinding_response) self.mox.ReplayAll() return fake_unbinding_response def _mock_out_network(self, neutron_network_id, docker_network_id, check_existing=False): no_networks_response = { "networks": [] } fake_list_response = { "networks": [{ "status": "ACTIVE", "subnets": [], "admin_state_up": True, "tenant_id": "9bacb3c5d39d41a79512987f338cf177", "router:external": False, "segments": [], "shared": False, "id": neutron_network_id }] } self.mox.StubOutWithMock(app.neutron, 'list_networks') t = utils.make_net_tags(docker_network_id) if check_existing: te = t + ',' + const.KURYR_EXISTING_NEUTRON_NET app.neutron.list_networks(tags=te).AndReturn( no_networks_response) app.neutron.list_networks(tags=t).AndReturn(fake_list_response) self.mox.ReplayAll() return fake_list_response

commit_message:
Revert "Move from "tenant" to "project""

This patch broke Fuxi since Fuxi doesn't support Keystone v3
yet. Let's revert it for now.

This reverts commit 7d8c7089592bf73062c720cf806a760070a728cf.

Change-Id: I4ecd10fee820fc6152b52b1d432967e66b48bbfc

commit_message:
Replace assertDictMatch with assertDictEqual method in tests

assertDictMatch was introduced for Python 2.6 only. Python 2.7+ contains
assertDictEqual.

Closes-Bug: #1646433
Change-Id: Iffd82226a157da918d45691bb487bbc554b9931a

commit_message:
Checking of tasks duplicates added to graph handler

The exception is raised if we try to save tasks duplicates to the
graph.

Change-Id: I315ff82cf51c27de893a514245cf254504ffaaeb
Closes-Bug: #1648786
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/04/415204/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_fail_on_task_duplication(self): resp = self.app.put( reverse( 'DeploymentGraphHandler', kwargs={'obj_id': self.custom_graph.id} ), jsonutils.dumps({ 'name': 'updated-graph-name', 'tasks': [ { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'puppet' }, { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'shell' } ] }), headers=self.default_headers, expect_errors=True ) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_code) self.assertEqual("Tasks duplication found: test-task2", resp.json_body['message']) resp = self.app.patch( reverse( 'DeploymentGraphHandler', kwargs={'obj_id': self.custom_graph.id} ), jsonutils.dumps({ 'name': 'updated-graph-name2', 'on_stop': {}, 'tasks': [ { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'puppet' }, { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'shell' } ] }), headers=self.default_headers, expect_errors=True ) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_code) self.assertEqual("Tasks duplication found: test-task2", resp.json_body['message']) def test_create_graph_failed_on_tasks_duplication(self): for related_class, ref_graph in six.iteritems(self.custom_graphs): resp = self.app.post( reverse( '{0}DeploymentGraphHandler'.format(related_class), kwargs={ 'obj_id': ref_graph['model'].id, 'graph_type': 'created-graph' } ), jsonutils.dumps({ 'name': 'custom-graph-name', 'tasks': [ { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'puppet' }, { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'shell' } ] }), headers=self.default_headers, expect_errors=True ) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_code) self.assertEqual("Tasks duplication found: test-task2", resp.json_body['message'])

commit_message:
Revert "9.2 add repos to Mitaka on Ubuntu"

The release repos should be updated using the upgrade procedure tooling e.g. via release API. Moreover the fixtures (openstack.yaml) should be updated as well.

This reverts commit 3be163a37227f9f2ce92ea581a980256bf7001a9.

Change-Id: Ie488c0b60d44a48f1401fceb66bcda8a8e7eb687

deleted_lines: upgrade_default_repos_for_mos_ubuntu() downgrade_default_repos_for_mos_ubuntu()# new repo metadata for Mitaka 9.2 on Ubuntu 14.04 MOS92_UPDATES_REPOS = [ { "name": "mos9.2-updates", "priority": 1050, "section": "main restricted", "suite": "mos9.0-updates", "type": "deb", 'uri': "http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/ubuntu/9.2/", }, { "name": "mos9.2-security", "priority": 1050, "section": "main restricted", "suite": "mos9.0-security", "type": "deb", 'uri': "http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/ubuntu/9.2/", }, { "name": "mos9.2-holdback", "priority": 1100, "section": "main restricted", "suite": "mos9.0-holdback", "type": "deb", 'uri': "http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/ubuntu/9.2/", }, ] def get_attribute_metadata(): connection = op.get_bind() select_query = sa.sql.text( "SELECT id, attributes_metadata FROM releases " "WHERE " "name in ('Mitaka on Ubuntu 14.04', 'Mitaka on Ubuntu+UCA 14.04')") return connection.execute(select_query) def set_attribute_metadata(release_id, attrs): connection = op.get_bind() update_query = sa.sql.text( "UPDATE releases SET attributes_metadata = " ":attributes_metadata WHERE id = :id") connection.execute( update_query, id=release_id, attributes_metadata=jsonutils.dumps(attrs)) def upgrade_default_repos_for_mos_ubuntu(): for release_id, attributes_metadata in get_attribute_metadata(): attrs = jsonutils.loads(attributes_metadata) attrs['editable']['repo_setup']['repos']['value']\ .extend(MOS92_UPDATES_REPOS) set_attribute_metadata(release_id, attrs) def downgrade_default_repos_for_mos_ubuntu(): for release_id, attributes_metadata in get_attribute_metadata(): attrs = jsonutils.loads(attributes_metadata) repos = attrs['editable']['repo_setup']['repos']['value'] attrs['editable']['repo_setup']['repos']['value'] = [] for x in repos: if x['uri'] != \ 'http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/ubuntu/9.2/': attrs['editable']['repo_setup']['repos']['value'].append(x) set_attribute_metadata(release_id, attrs)

commit_message:
[Bindep]Use bindep lib to install system packages

1.Fix install_rally.sh.Move all system packages from
  install_rally.sh script to separate file bindep.txt
  add call to bindep from install_rally.sh script
2.Add bindep command to tox.ini, we can use "tox
  -e bindep" to check the required system packages
  which is missing.
3.Install bindep when running Dockerfile

Change-Id: If4568c22d3b4f1c393c217d935cda233bd41d45e

commit_message:
Removes unnecessary utf-8 encoding

The following file(s) added utf-8 encoding but never used. So we can
remove them at all.

ironic_ui/__init__.py
ironic_ui/content/__init__.py

Change-Id: Id758fe02765b8d18600458ae4c7f9deb4e484476

commit_message:
Fix wrong keywords in nova-create-keystone-user

The keyword 'neutron' in chart.yaml of nova-create-keystone-user is
wrong, change it to 'nova'.

Change-Id: Id8cda7ca08f1afbdc3a8cb7d1c748022f389f076
Closes-Bug: #1652553

commit_message:
Rename tunnel_type in Chassis to tunnel_types

Since virtual tunnel port support multiple tunnel types at one time,
the tunnel type of Chassis should be a list.

Change-Id: Icb099c3d1304bfb3ebbda09b7b9a492e4877f757
Closes-Bug: #1652422

deleted_lines: def add_chassis(self, id, ip, tunnel_type): 'tunnel_type': tunnel_type}

commit_message:
Fix account creation with ceilometer-api disabled

With a recent patch, ceilometer-api is no more enabled by default.
With this new behavior, ceilometer user is no more created when using
gnocchi backend, leading to "Unauthorized" error when collectors
try to contact gnocchi API or for database upgrade.

This patch fixes the creation of ceilometer user with gnocchi backend

Change-Id: I2ed155b0a83763a453f86d840817d1ac7ef9c694

deleted_lines: # At this time, the /etc/openstack/clouds.yaml is available, # we could leverage that by setting OS_CLOUD OLD_OS_CLOUD=$OS_CLOUD export OS_CLOUD='devstack-admin' create_service_user "ceilometer" "admin" if is_service_enabled swift; then # Ceilometer needs ResellerAdmin role to access Swift account stats. get_or_add_user_project_role "ResellerAdmin" "ceilometer" $SERVICE_PROJECT_NAME fi export OS_CLOUD=$OLD_OS_CLOUD

commit_message:
Do not use message=msg in InvalidConfiguration

If using InvalidConfiguration(message=msg), msg will not
display properly, instead InvalidConfiguration(msg) should
be used.

Change-Id: I29b91b3db6179bfd4ffea5352f7fcf4cfb61055f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/66/415066/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

9.2 add repos to Mitaka on Ubuntu

That commit adds repositories required for MOS 9.2 to default template
of "Mitaka on Ubuntu 14.04" release.

Closes-Bug: #1650500
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/76/411876/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: upgrade_default_repos_for_mos_ubuntu() downgrade_default_repos_for_mos_ubuntu() # new repo metadata for Mitaka 9.2 on Ubuntu 14.04 MOS92_UPDATES_REPOS = [ { "name": "mos9.2-updates", "priority": 1050, "section": "main restricted", "suite": "mos9.0-updates", "type": "deb", 'uri': "http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/ubuntu/9.2/", }, { "name": "mos9.2-security", "priority": 1050, "section": "main restricted", "suite": "mos9.0-security", "type": "deb", 'uri': "http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/ubuntu/9.2/", }, { "name": "mos9.2-holdback", "priority": 1100, "section": "main restricted", "suite": "mos9.0-holdback", "type": "deb", 'uri': "http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/ubuntu/9.2/", }, ] def get_attribute_metadata(): connection = op.get_bind() select_query = sa.sql.text( "SELECT id, attributes_metadata FROM releases " "WHERE name = 'Mitaka on Ubuntu 14.04'") return connection.execute(select_query) def set_attribute_metadata(release_id, attrs): connection = op.get_bind() update_query = sa.sql.text( "UPDATE releases SET attributes_metadata = " ":attributes_metadata WHERE id = :id") connection.execute( update_query, id=release_id, attributes_metadata=jsonutils.dumps(attrs)) def upgrade_default_repos_for_mos_ubuntu(): for release_id, attributes_metadata in get_attribute_metadata(): attrs = jsonutils.loads(attributes_metadata) attrs['editable']['repo_setup']['repos']['value'].extend(MOS92_UPDATES_REPOS) set_attribute_metadata(release_id, attrs) def downgrade_default_repos_for_mos_ubuntu(): for release_id, attributes_metadata in get_attribute_metadata(): attrs = jsonutils.loads(attributes_metadata) value = attrs['editable']['repo_setup']['repos']['value'] attrs['editable']['repo_setup']['repos']['value'] = [] for x in value: if not x['uri'] == 'http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/ubuntu/9.2/': attrs['editable']['repo_setup']['repos']['value'].append(x) set_attribute_metadata(release_id, attrs)

commit_message:
Tap-as-a-service plugin

Change-Id: I449af9837bbcc6902fd39637772c84e7dcc9c4e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/07/396307/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Devstack tap as a service ------------------------- Tap device is intended for the tenant admin to perform network tracing for example for security purposes. The administrator will be able to run Snort IDS on VMs in his network - everything in cloud. For this purpose we want to add tap-as-a-service for the Dragonflow. Some terminology: TapService represents the port on which the mirrored traffic is delivered. For example this port can be attached to VM where a Snort IDS running. 'tap_services': { 'id': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'primary_key': True}, 'tenant_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'required_by_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, 'name': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, 'description': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, 'port_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'is_visible': True}, } TapFlow represents the port from which the traffic needs to be mirrored. 'tap_flows': { 'id': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'primary_key': True}, 'tenant_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'required_by_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, 'name': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, 'description': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, 'tap_service_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'required_by_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, 'source_port': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'required_by_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, 'direction': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:values': direction_enum}, 'is_visible': True} } direction_enum = ['IN', 'OUT', 'BOTH'] Multiple TapFlow instances can be associated with a single TapService instance. So, one Snort VM can check traffic of multiple virtual servers. TapFlow rule can be installed in multiple locations in openflow: 1. Tap rule on output 2. Tap rule on input 1. Tap on the output -------------------- We want to intercept packets coming out from the VM as close to the source. Packets arriving from VM are landed in table 0 (INGRESS_CLASSIFICATION_DISPATCH_TABLE). After marking packet with (set_field:0x8->reg6,set_field:0x1->metadata) packet is transmitted to table 1 (EGRESS_PORT_SECURITY_TABLE). In this table we check for packets going to meta-data service, and we transfer packets to other rules and flows. We must add our tapping rule here. We have a number of alternatives here ------------------------------------- We can switch table=1 (EGRESS_PORT_SECURITY_TABLE) from table=1 to be table=2 and install our tap rules in table=1. In table=1 we will add the following rules: Filter1:in_port=6 Actions:output(5), goto_table:1 Filter2:any Actions: goto_table=2 Another alternative, is to alter rule as VM port is added to the openflow rules. Old rule: Filter:in_port=6 Actions:set_field:0x8->reg6,set_field:0x1->metadata,goto_table:1 New rule: Filter:in_port:6 Actions:set_field:0x8->reg6,set_field:0x1->metadata,resubmit(,1), output(5) 2. Tap the input ---------------- In table=78 (INGRESS_DISPATCH_TABLE) we have rules: Filter:reg7=0x8 Actions:output:6 We can simply change it to: Filter:reg7=0x8 Actions:output:6,output(5) TODO: ----- 1. VM on different computer nodes 2. Tap of the tap (TapFlow of the TapService). List of relevant openflow tables -------------------------------- INGRESS_CLASSIFICATION_DISPATCH_TABLE = 0 EGRESS_PORT_SECURITY_TABLE = 1 INGRESS_DISPATCH_TABLE = 78

commit_message:
[Verify] Improve messages in logging and exceptions for verify API

Also, this patch adds small improvements to the base verifier manager,
and fixes rally-pg-py27-unit and rally-mysql-py27-unit jobs.

Change-Id: Ica750fd1842ee4912cebad067bcac57945cf4801
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/10/415010/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(andreykurilin): Move support of default meta to MetaMixin. return os.path.join(self.base_dir, "for-deployment-%s" % self.verifier.deployment["uuid"]) """Override verifier configuration.""" def install_extension(self, source, version=None, extra_settings=None): _LE("'%s' verifiers don't support extensions.") % self.get_name()) _LE("'%s' verifiers don't support extensions.") % self.get_name()) def parse_results(self, results_data): # TODO(andreykurilin): Support more formats. return subunit_v2.parse(six.StringIO(results_data))
deleted_lines: # TODO(andreykurilin): move support of default meta to MetaMixin return os.path.join( self.base_dir, "for-deployment-%s" % self.verifier.deployment["uuid"]) """Override verifier's configuration.""" def install_extension(self, source, version=None, extra=None): _LE("'%s' verifiers don't support extensions.") % self.get_name()) _LE("'%s' verifiers don't support extensions.") % self.get_name()) def parse_results(self, data): # TODO(andreykurilin): support more formats return subunit_v2.parse(six.StringIO(data))

commit_message:
Add unittest entry point for python strolet app

With this change, we are able to run the app unit tests via tox command.

This one also adds a simple unit test for StorletSamples.

Change-Id: I24be75dfb10aaae8db7345e7f89ddc36e93a24fa

commit_message:
[2/4]Reset group snapshot status

Currently the administrator could only reset the group snapshot
status by db operation, this change intends to add new admin
action to achieve this.

The patch list:
    1. group API(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389091/).
    2. group snapshot API(this).
    3. cinder client(https://review.openstack.org/390169/).
    4. documentation(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395464/).

APIImpact
DocImpact
Partial-Implements: blueprint reset-cg-and-cgs-status

commit_message:
Checking of tasks duplicates added to graph handler

The exception is raised if we try to save tasks duplicates to the
graph.

Change-Id: I315ff82cf51c27de893a514245cf254504ffaaeb
Closes-Bug: #1648786

added_lines: def test_fail_on_task_duplication(self): resp = self.app.put( reverse( 'DeploymentGraphHandler', kwargs={'obj_id': self.custom_graph.id} ), jsonutils.dumps({ 'name': 'updated-graph-name', 'tasks': [ { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'puppet' }, { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'shell' } ] }), headers=self.default_headers, expect_errors=True ) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_code) self.assertEqual("Tasks duplication found: test-task2", resp.json_body['message']) resp = self.app.patch( reverse( 'DeploymentGraphHandler', kwargs={'obj_id': self.custom_graph.id} ), jsonutils.dumps({ 'name': 'updated-graph-name2', 'on_stop': {}, 'tasks': [ { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'puppet' }, { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'shell' } ] }), headers=self.default_headers, expect_errors=True ) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_code) self.assertEqual("Tasks duplication found: test-task2", resp.json_body['message']) def test_create_graph_failed_on_tasks_duplication(self): for related_class, ref_graph in six.iteritems(self.custom_graphs): resp = self.app.post( reverse( '{0}DeploymentGraphHandler'.format(related_class), kwargs={ 'obj_id': ref_graph['model'].id, 'graph_type': 'created-graph' } ), jsonutils.dumps({ 'name': 'custom-graph-name', 'tasks': [ { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'puppet' }, { 'id': 'test-task2', 'type': 'shell' } ] }), headers=self.default_headers, expect_errors=True ) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_code) self.assertEqual("Tasks duplication found: test-task2", resp.json_body['message'])

commit_message:
Allow fs creation if mountpoint is not specified

Such services as Swift-storage require partition with file
system without mountpoints, currently fuel-agent prevents
to do that.

Change-Id: Id9e90f81098de3736e0d9b1ca82e434122efd4e8
Closes-bug: #1650622
(cherry picked from commit d9f9f377e4c281fbbb070dda36952938e9dfa825)

commit_message:
Allow fs creation if mountpoint is not specified

Such services as Swift-storage require partition with file
system without mountpoints, currently fuel-agent prevents
to do that.

Change-Id: Id9e90f81098de3736e0d9b1ca82e434122efd4e8
Closes-bug: #1650622

call.

commit_message:
Add check for unsupported resource to tmpl migrate

Add check method for deprecated and hidden resources to
template migrate mechanism and add warnings/errors to
corresponding lists.

implements bp heat-template-port

Change-Id: I1df2285c351f9e61059da8d8bc8d722570f18587
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/77/373377/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine import plugin_manager from heat.engine import support self.check_hidden_resources(self.template.get('resources')) def check_hidden_resources(self, template_resources): if template_resources is None: return all_resources = _load_all_resources() for name, rsrc in template_resources.items(): if all_resources.get(rsrc['type']) is None: continue support_status = all_resources[rsrc['type']].support_status action = None if support_status.status == support.DEPRECATED: # raise LOG warning, but don't raise message about not full # migration action = 'log' elif support_status.status == support.HIDDEN: action = 'raise' msg = _('Resource\'s "%(name)s" type is %(status)s and ' 'not supported: %(msg)s') % dict( name=name, status=support_status.status, msg=support_status.message) if action and action == 'log': self.warnings.append(msg) elif action and action == 'raise': self.errors.append(msg) def _load_all_resources(): manager = plugin_manager.PluginManager('heat.engine.resources') resource_mapping = plugin_manager.PluginMapping('resource') res_plugin_mappings = resource_mapping.load_all(manager) all_resources = {} for mapping in res_plugin_mappings: name, cls = mapping all_resources[name] = cls return all_resources

commit_message:
Add migrate version to actual HOT template version

Add to template migrate mechanism version migration to
actual heat_template_version (currently it is 2016-10-14).

NOTE: Due to version migration, mechanism supports since this patch and
should not raise NotSupported error.

implements bp heat-template-port

Change-Id: I2ff53dab18804e86b243ae0f87ef50a7a9530260

added_lines: """Method to migrate template with obsolete format to actual. :raises Error: if there was any error during migration. """ else: self.migrate_version(self.template) def migrate_version(self, template): if cfn_tmpl.CfnTemplate.VERSION in self.template: del self.template[cfn_tmpl.CfnTemplate.VERSION] elif cfn_tmpl.CfnTemplate.ALTERNATE_VERSION in self.template: del self.template[cfn_tmpl.CfnTemplate.ALTERNATE_VERSION] template[self.actual_template_class.VERSION] = ( self.actual_template_codeversion)

commit_message:
Add function migration to template migrate

Add migration to next functions:

  * Fn::GetAtt
  * Ref
  * Fn::Join
  * Fn::Split
  * Fn::ResourceFacade
  * Fn::FindInMap
  * Fn::Replace
  * Fn::MemberListToMap
  * Fn::Not
  * Fn::Equals
  * Fn::If
  * Fn::And
  * Fn::Or

Also, there are three exceptions, which have special
solution:

  * Fn::Select - adding index to related get_param or get_attr
    functions.
  * Fn::GetAZs - replacing with ['nova'] (due to original function).
  * Fn::Base64 - replacing with it's value.
  * pseudo-parameter AWS::Region - adding new parameter AWS::Region and
    ref with get_param on it.

implements bp heat-template-port

Change-Id: I61af3c5ab8f4ba1a328c298d5a414fc7dc7cfb6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/75/373375/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import collections * Obsolete and removed functions migrated to actual supported functions. functions_to_migrate = ['Fn::GetAtt', 'Ref', 'Fn::Join', 'Fn::Split', 'Fn::ResourceFacade', 'Fn::FindInMap', 'Fn::Replace', 'Fn::MemberListToMap', 'Fn::Not', 'Fn::Equals', 'Fn::If', 'Fn::And', 'Fn::Or'] special_functions = ['Fn::Select', 'Fn::GetAZs', 'Fn::Base64'] # special case for AWS::Region pseudo-parameter, need to add to # special_functions special_functions.append('Ref') if self.is_function(item, special=True): self.migrate_special_function(data, data_key=idx, path=path) elif isinstance(data, dict): if self.is_function(data): self.migrate_function(data, path) if self.is_function(data[k], special=True): self.migrate_special_function(data, data_key=k, path=path) def is_function(self, data, special=False): if not isinstance(data, dict) or len(data.keys()) != 1: return False return list(data.keys())[0] in (self.functions_to_migrate if not special else self.special_functions) def migrate_special_function(self, data, data_key, path=''): func = data[data_key] func_name = list(func.keys())[0] func_expr = func.get(func_name) if func_name == 'Ref': if func_expr != 'AWS::Region': return if 'parameters' not in self.template: self.template['parameters'] = {} self.template['parameters'].update({'AWS::Region': dict( type='string', default='ap-southeast-1', allowed_values=['us-east-1', 'us-west-1', 'us-west-2', 'sa-east-1', 'eu-west-1', 'ap-southeast-1', 'ap-northeast-1'])}) result = {'get_param': 'AWS::Region'} elif func_name == 'Fn::Select': selector = func_expr[0] collection = func_expr[1] if isinstance(collection, collections.Mapping): if list(collection.keys())[0] == 'get_attr': result_value = list(collection.values())[0] if not isinstance(result_value, list): result_value = [result_value, selector] else: result_value.append(selector) result = {'get_attr': result_value} elif list(collection.keys())[0] == 'get_param': result_value = list(collection.values())[0] if not isinstance(result_value, list): result_value = [result_value, selector] else: result_value.append(selector) result = {'get_param': result_value} else: try: result = collection[selector] except KeyError: msg = _('Error in migrating %(path)s : Specified ' '%(func)s function has incorrect selector ' 'to resolve') % dict(path=path, func=func_name) self.errors.append(msg) return elif isinstance(collection, collections.Sequence): if hasattr(selector, 'isdigit') and selector.isdigit(): selector = int(selector) try: result = collection[selector] except KeyError: msg = _('Error in migrating %(path)s : Specified ' '%(func)s function has incorrect selector ' 'to resolve') % dict(path=path, func=func_name) self.errors.append(msg) return else: msg = _('Error in migrating %(path)s : Specified ' '%(func)s function has incorrect collection ' 'to resolve') % dict(path=path, func=func_name) self.errors.append(msg) return elif func_name == 'Fn::Base64': result = func_expr elif func_name == 'Fn::GetAZs': result = ['nova'] else: self.errors.append(_('Error in migrating %(path)s : currently ' '%(fn)s function migration is not ' 'supported. Please, change it ' 'manually for full template ' 'migration') % dict(path=path, fn=func_name)) result = func data[data_key] = result def migrate_function(self, data, path=''): func_name = list(data.keys())[0] func_expr = data.get(func_name) result_key = None result_expr = None if func_name in ['Fn::GetAtt', 'Fn::Join', 'Fn::Split', 'Fn::ResourceFacade', 'Fn::FindInMap']: mapping = {'Fn::ResourceFacade': 'resource_facade', 'Fn::GetAtt': 'get_attr', 'Fn::Join': 'list_join', 'Fn::Split': 'str_split', 'Fn::FindInMap': 'get_param'} result_key = mapping[func_name] elif func_name == 'Ref': ref_func = None if (self.template.get('parameters') and func_expr in self.template['parameters']): ref_func = 'get_param' elif (self.template.get('resources') and func_expr in self.template['resources']): ref_func = 'get_resource' elif func_expr in ['AWS::StackId', 'AWS::StackName']: ref_func = 'get_param' result_expr = {'AWS::StackId': 'OS::stack_id', 'AWS::StackName': 'OS::stack_name'}[func_expr] elif func_expr in ['AWS::NoValue', 'AWS::NotificationARNs', 'AWS::AccountId']: msg = _('Next pseudo parameters are not supported in HOT ' 'format templates: %s') % ', '.join( ['AWS::NoValue', 'AWS::NotificationARNs', 'AWS::AccountId']) self.errors.append(msg) return if ref_func: result_key = ref_func else: raise exception.InvalidTemplateReference( resource=func_expr, key=self.makepath(path, func_name)) elif func_name == 'Fn::Replace': result_key = 'str_replace' result_expr = {'params': func_expr[0], 'template': func_expr[1]} elif func_name == 'Fn::MemberListToMap': result_key = 'yaql' result_expr = { 'expression': "let(key => $.data[0], value => $.data[1]) -> " "dict($.data[2].select(" "$.split('.member.')[1].split('.')).select(" "[$[0], $[1].split('=')[0].replace({$key => 0, " "$value => 1}), $[1].split('=')", 'params': {'data': func_expr} } # check for condition functions elif func_name in ['Fn::Equals', 'Fn::If', 'Fn::And', 'Fn::Or']: result_key = {'Fn::Equals': 'equals', 'Fn::If': 'if', 'Fn::And': 'and', 'Fn::Or': 'or'}[func_name] elif func_name == 'Fn::Not': result_key = 'not' result_expr = func_expr[0] else: self.errors.append(_('Error in migrating %(path)s : currently ' '%(fn)s function migration is not ' 'supported') % dict(path=path, fn=func_name)) if result_key is not None: data[result_key] = (result_expr if result_expr is not None else func_expr) del data[func_name]

commit_message:
Add resource keys translation in template migrate

Implement translation old format resources entries keys
to actual HOT format. For example, if old template has
resource with keys:

Resource:
  Type: OS::Heat::Value
  Properties:
    value: check

then migrated template will look like:

Resource:
  type: OS::Heat::Value
  properties:
    value: check

implements bp heat-template-port

Change-Id: I2c7d2c804f71f088f0ab994bf68878bc89795f91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/74/373374/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Translate resources entries keys to actual format. self.migrate_data(self.template) def makepath(self, *args): if not args: return '' path = '' for arg in args: if not path and arg: path = arg continue if isinstance(arg, int) or arg.isdigit(): path = '%(path)s[%(arg)s]' % dict(path=path, arg=arg) elif arg: path = '%(path)s.%(arg)s' % dict(path=path, arg=arg) return path def migrate_data(self, data, path=''): if isinstance(data, list): for idx, item in enumerate(data): new_path = self.makepath(path, idx) self.migrate_data(item, path=new_path) elif isinstance(data, dict): if self.is_resource(data): self.migrate_resource_names(data) for k in data: new_path = self.makepath(path, k) self.migrate_data(data[k], path=new_path) def is_resource(self, data): return len(set(data.keys()) - set(self._CFN_TO_HOT_ATTRS.keys())) == 0 def migrate_resource_names(self, data): for key in data: hot_key = None if key in self._CFN_TO_HOT_ATTRS: hot_key = self._CFN_TO_HOT_ATTRS[key] if hot_key: data[hot_key] = data[key] del data[key]

commit_message:
Add parameters and outputs template migrate

Add to template migrate mechanism parameters and
outputs entries keys to actual HOT format, for example
if original template has parameter:

Param:
  Type: String
  Description: Test param
  MinLength: 1
  MaxLength: 64
  Default: test

then migrated template will have parameter with actual HOT format:

Param:
  type: string
  description: Test param
  default: test
  constraints:
    length:
      min: 1
      max: 64

implements bp heat-template-port

Change-Id: I9f9e864890e0847ffc0475a10c5abd06a343d0c0

added_lines: from heat.engine.cfn import template as cfn_tmpl from heat.engine.hot import parameters as hot_paramsfrom heat.engine import parameters as cfn_params * Translate parameters entries keys to actual format. * Translate outputs entries keys to actual format. self.migrate_parameters_attributes(self.template.get('parameters')) self.migrate_outputs_attributes(self.template.get('outputs')) def migrate_parameters_attributes(self, params): if not params: return hot_keys = hot_params.HOTParamSchema cfn_to_hot_keys = { cfn_params.DESCRIPTION: hot_keys.DESCRIPTION, cfn_params.DEFAULT: hot_keys.DEFAULT, cfn_params.LABEL: hot_keys.LABEL, cfn_params.NO_ECHO: hot_keys.HIDDEN } for k, v in params.items(): v[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS] = {} value_keys = v.keys() for param_k in value_keys: if param_k == cfn_params.TYPE: types_translate = dict(zip( cfn_params.Schema.TYPES, hot_params.HOTParamSchema.TYPES)) if v[param_k] not in cfn_params.Schema.TYPES: msg = _('Type %(type)s in parameter %(name)s is ' 'not in valid types') % dict(type=v[param_k], name=k) self.errors.append(msg) v[hot_keys.TYPE] = types_translate[v[param_k]] del v[param_k] if param_k in cfn_to_hot_keys.keys(): v[cfn_to_hot_keys[param_k]] = v.get(param_k) del v[param_k] self.migrate_parameter_constraints(param_k, v) if not v[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS]: del v[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS] def migrate_parameter_constraints(self, key, data): hot_keys = hot_params.HOTParamSchema if key == cfn_params.ALLOWED_VALUES: data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS].update( {hot_params.ALLOWED_VALUES: data[key]}) del data[key] elif key == cfn_params.ALLOWED_PATTERN: data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS].update( {hot_params.ALLOWED_PATTERN: data[key]}) del data[key] elif key == cfn_params.MAX_LENGTH: if not data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS].get(hot_params.LENGTH): data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_params.LENGTH] = {} data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_params.LENGTH][ hot_params.MAX] = data[key] del data[key] elif key == cfn_params.MIN_LENGTH: if not data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS].get(hot_params.LENGTH): data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_params.LENGTH] = {} data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_params.LENGTH][ hot_params.MIN] = data[key] del data[key] elif key == cfn_params.MAX_VALUE: if not data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS].get(hot_params.RANGE): data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_params.RANGE] = {} data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_params.RANGE][ hot_params.MAX] = data[key] del data[key] elif key == cfn_params.MIN_VALUE: if not data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS].get(hot_params.RANGE): data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_params.RANGE] = {} data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_params.RANGE][ hot_params.MIN] = data[key] del data[key] elif key == cfn_params.CONSTRAINT_DESCRIPTION: data[hot_keys.CONSTRAINTS][hot_keys.DESCRIPTION] = data[key] del data[key] def migrate_outputs_attributes(self, tmpl_outputs): if not tmpl_outputs: return cfn_to_hot_keys = dict(zip(cfn_tmpl.CfnTemplate.OUTPUT_KEYS, self.actual_template_class.OUTPUT_KEYS)) for k, v in tmpl_outputs.items(): for output_k in v: if output_k in cfn_to_hot_keys: v[cfn_to_hot_keys[output_k]] = v[output_k] del v[output_k]

commit_message:
Initial implementation template migrate mechanism

Initial implementation template migrate mechanism class
with ability to translate "Mappings" section to parameters
and translate obsolete sections names to actual HOT format.

implements bp heat-template-port

Change-Id: Ibf29375cf4543be16bcffbcba7c044b767252d04

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.engine import function class TemplateMigrate(object): def __init__(self, template): self.template = template def migrate(self, data=None): if data is None: data = self.template if isinstance(data, list): for item in data: self.migrate(item) elif isinstance(data, dict): for k, v in data.items(): self.migrate(v) if self.is_function(data): self.migrate_functions(data) def is_function(self, data): if len(data.keys()) != 1: return False functions = {} return list(data.keys())[0] in functions def migrate_functions(self, data): pass

commit_message:
Heat template migrate mechanism

[1] suggests template migrate mechanism, which translates
deprecated and hidden properties to currently supported.
This spec offers full mechanism of template migration -
translate functions, sections, conditions (when they will
be fully implemented).

implements bp heat-template-port
Depends-on: I9c564ad3c9b6b309bb9664d4503651ace204c3aa

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/228424/

Change-Id: I015486af296a89fcc932d5ce76b814f7223b6bc3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/59/333259/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ================================================= Heat template to latest version migrate mechanism ================================================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/example `Heat template-migrate`_ blueprint declares mechanism of migrating all deprecated and hidden properties in user template to currently supported. This spec move on the mechanism and suggests to upgrade all template from old version to the newer. Problem description =================== Currently there are many versions of Heat template, and there are a lot of new features in each new version. Properties fall into deprecated or hidden status, functions become obsolete, new sections and approaches appear - old templates become inoperable. Therefore mechanism of migrating template from older version to the newer is necessary. Proposed change =============== Next steps should be implemented: 1. Deprecated and hidden properties and attributes should be migrated to their supported analogues, like `subnet_id` and `subnet` of `OS::Neutron::Port` resource plugin. This step is descripted in `Heat template-migrate`_ spec. 2. All sections names should be translated to actual form, e.g. old template version is ``HeatTemplateFormatVersion.2012-12-12`` and it contains `Properties` section, upgraded template section should be named with `properties`. Same for `deletion_policies` keys (since ``hot_template_version.2016-10-14``). 3. All obsolete intrinsic functions should be upgraded to their actual equivalents: * `Fn::GetAtt` - `get_attr` * `Ref` - `get_param` - when function for parameter * `Ref` - `get_resource` - when function for resource * `Fn::Join` - `list_join` * `Fn::Split` - `str_split` * `Fn::ResourceFacade` - `resource_facade` * `Fn::Select` - adding index to related `get_param` or `get_attr` function * `Fn::FindInMap` - equivalent to related `get_param` or `get_attr` function * `Fn::Replace` - `str_replace` The exceptions are: * `Fn::MemberListToMap` - it has no equivalent in current template, so should raise message for the user to get rid of it in template. * `Fn::Base64` - should be replaced with it's value * `Fn::GetAZs` - should be replaced with value of function's result. 4. All hidden and deprecated resource plugins should raise message for the user to replace them to actual format. For example: `OS::Neutron::RouterGateway` will raise message, which contained in support status. 5. After `Resource conditions`_ will be implemented, templates with ``AWSTemplateFormatVersion`` can be safely upgraded to the latest heat template version. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: prazumovsky KanagarajM Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: newton-2 Work Items ---------- * Add upgrading mechanism for Heat templates functions and resources * After `Resource conditions`_ implementation will be done, update mechanism for conditions * Add related functional tests for different template versions Dependencies ============ - `Heat template-migrate`_ - `Resource conditions`_ .. _Heat template-migrate: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/228424/ .. _Resource conditions: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245042/

commit_message:
Updated bootstrap repos after fuel-bootstrap-cli reinstall

Default fuel-bootstrap-cli conf file which is provided
by the package does not contain repos. We need to update
repos from astute.yaml before being able to build bootstrap
image.

Change-Id: I30ed1c372e7b2107f810e784c1d56807d3412527
Closes-Bug: #1644411

Trivial: Modify the description of policy validate

The spec file should be of the policy to be validated, not created.

commit_message:
Add new tests for nailgun extension 'Infrastructure-As-Code'
add test "iac_git_download_settings"
add test "iac_git_install_remove_package"
add test "iac_git_set_non_openstack_settings"

Change-Id: I346862adbb4c504148636f5736558da6a8edbd0e
Implements: bp test-puppet-resource-override
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/57/397257/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from proboscis import test from fuelweb_test.helpers.decorators import log_snapshot_after_test from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import SetupEnvironment from fuelweb_test.tests.base_test_case import TestBasic from fuelweb_test import logger @test(groups=["iac_git"]) class TestIronicBase(TestBasic): """TestIronicBase""" # TODO documentation @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_3], groups=["iac_git_clone"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def deploy_plugin( self): """Deploy cluster in HA mode with Ironic: Scenario: 1. Create cluster 2. Add 3 controller node 3. Add 1 compute node 4. Deploy cluster 5. Verify network 6. Run OSTF 7. Install extension Snapshot: ironic_base """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_5_slaves") data = { 'tenant': 'iac_git_clone', 'user': 'iac_git_clone', 'password': 'iac_git_clone' } self.show_step(1, initialize=True) self.show_step(2) self.show_step(3) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings=data ) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['compute'], 'slave-05': ['compute'] } ) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(6) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id=cluster_id) self.show_step(7) self.fuel_web.add_local_centos_mirror( cluster_id=cluster_id, path='mirror.fuel-infra.org/mos-repos/centos/mos-master-centos7' '/os/x86_64/', priority=1001) command = 'yum -y update && yum -y install && \ fuel-nailgun-extension-iac && fuel2 gitrepo create \ --env=1 --name=test \ --url="git@github.com:valentyn-yakovlev/demo-lcm.git \ --ref=master --key=/root/.ssh/id_rsa"' nailgun = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_name(cluster_id=cluster_id) result = self.fuel_web.ssh_manager.execute( nailgun['ip'], command)['stdout'] logger.info(result) self.env.make_snapshot("iac_git_clone")

commit_message:
Fix tempest.conf generation

[service_available] is not being generated. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I211c7aa3343c374585ef6d83006f402c5a59e1dd
Closes-Bug: #1613542
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/83/359583/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: config.register_opt_group(conf, project_config.service_available_group, project_config.ServiceAvailableGroup) return [ (project_config.baremetal_group.name, project_config.BaremetalGroup), ('service_available', project_config.ServiceAvailableGroup) ]

commit_message:
VXLAN support for OVS-DPDK

* restriction for using DPDK in VXLAN based
  segmentation case was removed
* in case of using VXLAN with DDPDK used 'br-mesh'
  bridge that has configuration as 'br-prv' and
  vendor specific attribute 'vlan_id' was added
  for 'add-br'
* appropriate tests were added

Implements blueprint vxlan-support-for-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: I1c4978a15df6f851339a346fe6c4812c5427dd29
(cherry picked from commit 8e01bc81479cf888eab2c0e0a8ee8cb3f8dd5374)

commit_message:
Separate Datastax repository from the Midonet one

Datastax was embedded in midonet.repo which doesn't feel quite right.

Change-Id: I60c7b71c69c9348ec62915781c89318dcb882ad9
(cherry picked from commit b16ea2536fda3013a70b512e055ceaa3529c172c)

subject: Enable MidoNet element to install MEM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-23 20:18:05.000000000', 'files': ['elements/overcloud-network-midonet/install.d/00-midonet-manager', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/extra-data.d/60-create-midonet-repositories', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/environment.d/02-midonet-envs.bash', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/extra-data.d/midonet-mem', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/source-repository-overcloud-network-midonet', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/extra-data.d/logstash', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/extra-data.d/elasticsearch', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/extra-data.d/vbernat-llpd', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/install.d/72-pip'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements/commit/738dc7eb84ddc30deac22ec887f8f7943005d595', 'message': 'Enable MidoNet element to install MEM

Up until now thorough testing was only conducted with the open source version of
MidoNet.

More repositories are enabled when building a MEM base image: logstash,
vbernat-llpd and elasticsearch.

Also additional RPM packages are installed. This is being done using YUM
directly (due to the fact that we cannot install some packages depending
on certain conditions).

Change-Id: Ic88f268f783fcb014d1d19988780758cba762e57
(cherry picked from commit e58dc17e6ae29c1258a5acc4a18d4ecac43062c5)

commit_message:
Enable MidoNet element to install MEM

Up until now thorough testing was only conducted with the open source version of
MidoNet.

More repositories are enabled when building a MEM base image: logstash,
vbernat-llpd and elasticsearch.

Also additional RPM packages are installed. This is being done using YUM
directly (due to the fact that we cannot install some packages depending
on certain conditions).

Change-Id: Ic88f268f783fcb014d1d19988780758cba762e57
(cherry picked from commit e58dc17e6ae29c1258a5acc4a18d4ecac43062c5)

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from oslo-incubator,
we have retired oslo-incubator,so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: I26d40dbd5ee9ef306c460b6864952b264ffa81c9

commit_message:
Add validators to the controllers

This patch adds schema for the container create, container run &
image create operation, and adds corresponding decorators in controllers.

NOTE: More code cleanup and UTs addition will be done in subsequent
patches.

Partially-Implements: blueprint api-json-input-validation
Change-Id: I646db842d3dddc41da752e484790724254905781

commit_message:
Rename virt driver from 'docker' to 'zun'

The rationals are as following:
* Make it clear that the in-tree virt driver is not the same as the
  nova-docker driver
* Justify that Zun is going to support additional runtime
* Avoid name collision with nova-docker on packaging.

Change-Id: I08f9cc0100837f62c57e2e77cd7f6cd727b91b69
Closes-Bug: #1652387

commit_message:
Debug revert "Ignore heartbeats lock fails"

This reverts commit 898bcca75224ad82fa98a85b77651faaf554e2b6.

Change-Id: I3bd7617e790062ed07313e5ae0d12b75e12f0ec0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/07/415107/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Ignore heartbeats lock fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-13 11:09:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent/commit/bf0294fa409b67a7eccfd51186f9d1ac0c3e7c59', 'message': 'Ignore heartbeats lock fails

Stomp heartbeat handling is quite poorly designed. It happens in a
separate thread which sleeps, then tries to read a heartbeat if reading
mutex is acquired by message receiving thread it fails and increases
lock failure count. Upon reaching the limit (in our packets it is 2 by
default) it forcibly closes the connetion causing reconnect. Setting the
value to 0 turns the feature off.

Change-Id: I2187ce69508c530073582c542c963014acc5123a
Closes-Bug: #1613246
Closes-Bug: #1298262
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-13 11:10:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent/commit/a8a1bc4696cbc5c8ba4971c58d892d4ad94512a9', 'message': 'Ignore heartbeats lock fails

Stomp heartbeat handling is quite poorly designed. It happens in a
separate thread which sleeps, then tries to read a heartbeat if reading

commit_message:
Ignore heartbeats lock fails

Stomp heartbeat handling is quite poorly designed. It happens in a
separate thread which sleeps, then tries to read a heartbeat if reading
mutex is acquired by message receiving thread it fails and increases
lock failure count. Upon reaching the limit (in our packets it is 2 by
default) it forcibly closes the connetion causing reconnect. Setting the
value to 0 turns the feature off.

Change-Id: I2187ce69508c530073582c542c963014acc5123a
Closes-Bug: #1613246
Closes-Bug: #1298262

commit_message:
Ignore heartbeats lock fails

Stomp heartbeat handling is quite poorly designed. It happens in a
separate thread which sleeps, then tries to read a heartbeat if reading
mutex is acquired by message receiving thread it fails and increases
lock failure count. Upon reaching the limit (in our packets it is 2 by
default) it forcibly closes the connetion causing reconnect. Setting the
value to 0 turns the feature off.

commit_message:
Add the resume_guests_state_on_host_boot option to nova::compute

Adds the resume_guests_state_on_host_boot parameter to the
nova::compute class. When a compute node is restarted and having
this option set to true will ensure that any guests that were running
when the node was rebooted will be started up again.

Default value for the resume_guests_state_on_host_boot in the nova
code is False.

Change-Id: I8b7ba48c68aefa9e1fd7092e9e64b9567d138dcf

commit_message:
Add resize_confirm_window option to nova::compute

Adds the resize_confirm_window nova configuration option
to nova::compute. Setting this value will make sure resizes
are automically confirmed after the N number of seconds.

Change-Id: Ibcc43a7a68b2df04155c56bf9d834c5f972d189c

commit_message:
Add image command support in zunclient

With commit : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/380298/
image endpoint was added. This commit adds the image
endpoints in zunclient

Change-Id: Ie8a986baca41493aa960a8aa6934a73776501589
Implements: blueprint add-image-endpoint
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zunclient refs/changes/12/407112/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from six.moves.urllib import parse from zunclient.common import base from zunclient.common import utils from zunclient import exceptions PULL_ATTRIBUTES = ['repo'] class Image(base.Resource): def __repr__(self): return "<Image %s>" % self._info class ImageManager(base.Manager): resource_class = Image @staticmethod def _path(id=None): if id: return '/v1/images/%s' % id else: return '/v1/images/' def list(self, marker=None, limit=None, sort_key=None, sort_dir=None, detail=False): """Retrieve a list of images. :param marker: Optional, the UUID of an image, eg the last image from a previous result set. Return the next result set. :param limit: The maximum number of results to return per request, if: 1) limit > 0, the maximum number of images to return. 2) limit == 0, return the entire list of images. 3) limit param is NOT specified (None), the number of items returned respect the maximum imposed by the Zun api :param sort_key: Optional, field used for sorting. :param sort_dir: Optional, direction of sorting, either 'asc' (the default) or 'desc'. :param detail: Optional, boolean whether to return detailed information about images. :returns: A list of images. """ if limit is not None: limit = int(limit) filters = utils.common_filters(marker, limit, sort_key, sort_dir) path = '' if detail: path += 'detail' if filters: path += '?' + '&'.join(filters) if limit is None: return self._list(self._path(path), "images") else: return self._list_pagination(self._path(path), "images", limit=limit) def get(self, id): try: return self._list(self._path(id))[0] except IndexError: return None def create(self, **kwargs): new = {} for (key, value) in kwargs.items(): if key in PULL_ATTRIBUTES: new[key] = value else: raise exceptions.InvalidAttribute( "Key must be in %s" % ','.join(PULL_ATTRIBUTES)) return self._create(self._path(), new) def _action(self, id, action, method='POST', qparams=None, **kwargs): if qparams: action = "%s?%s" % (action, parse.urlencode(qparams)) kwargs.setdefault('headers', {}) kwargs['headers'].setdefault('Content-Length', '0') resp, body = self.api.json_request(method, self._path(id) + action, **kwargs) return resp, body

Change-Id: I48dc6da29534bf0c477c742311ac15438d8b63ad

commit_message:
Non-clustered VM live migration fix

When live migrating instances, we always request a
'VirtualSystemAndStorage' migration type.

In general, this works with shared storage as well, in which case
the instance disks should no be moved. Still, it's causing issues
when the instance disk files are placed on storage spaces disks.

This can be avoided by requesting the instance disks not to be
migrated.

This change addresses this issue, adding the 'migrate_disks' switch
argument to the 'live_migrate_vm' method.

Change-Id: I48dc6da29534bf0c477c742311ac15438d8b63ad
Closes-Bug: #1618446
(cherry picked from commit fcdbf99153ab48eeee2f641777b3fb10c06db02f)

commit_message:
Add test for multiqueue+DPDK+Numa nodes combination

This test should be executed for as part of validation of NFV feature;
required env vars:
KVM_ENABLE=true
DRIVER_ENABLE_ACPI=true
SLAVE_NODE_CPU=6
NUMA_NODES=2

Change-Id: Ie6a73fe20671379c9a8eae26faecf0768f15f57e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/08/409108/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def check_cpu_pinning_requirements(): assert_true(settings.KVM_USE) assert_true(settings.ACPI_ENABLE) assert_true(settings.HARDWARE['slave_node_cpu'] >= 6) assert_true(settings.HARDWARE['numa_nodes'] >= 2) @test(groups=["multiqueue_with_dpdk_and_numa"], depends_on_groups=["prepare_slaves_5"]) def multiqueue_with_dpdk_and_numa(self): """Deploy cluster with DPDK+Cpu Pin for multiqueue check Scenario: 1. Create cluster - Neutron VLAN, Ceph for all 2. Add 3 controllers and 3 compute+ceph-osd nodes 3. Configure dpdk, cpu pinning and hugepages on all computes 4. Deploy cluster 5. Run OSTF 6. Edit TestVM metadata - add hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=true 7. Create aggregate with "pinned=true" metadata for 2 computes 8. Create flavor 9. Spawn 2 instances, allocate floating IP to both 10. Enable queues in instances and check it 11. Check connectivity between instances """ self.check_cpu_pinning_requirements() self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_5_slaves") self.env.bootstrap_nodes([self.env.d_env.get_node(name='slave-06')]) self.show_step(1) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings={ 'volumes_lvm': False, 'volumes_ceph': True, 'images_ceph': True, 'objects_ceph': True} ) self.show_step(self.next_step) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['compute', 'ceph-osd'], 'slave-05': ['compute', 'ceph-osd'], 'slave-06': ['compute', 'ceph-osd'] } ) self.show_step(self.next_step) computes = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, ['compute'], role_status='pending_roles') for compute in computes: self.fuel_web.setup_hugepages( compute['id'], hp_2mb=512, hp_dpdk_mb=256) self.fuel_web.enable_dpdk(compute['id']) self.fuel_web.enable_cpu_pinning( compute['id'], cpu_count=settings.HARDWARE["slave_node_cpu"] - 1) self.show_step(self.next_step) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(self.next_step) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id) # update image's metadata self.show_step(self.next_step) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id)) test_vm_image = os_conn.glance.images.find(name="TestVM") test_vm_image.update(properties={'hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled': True}) # create aggregate for first compute self.show_step(self.next_step) compute1 = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_name('slave-04') compute2 = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_node_by_name('slave-05') aggregate_name = 'system_tests' + str(random.randint(0, 1000)) os_conn.create_aggregate(aggregate_name, metadata={'pinned': 'true'}, hosts=[compute1['fqdn'], compute2['fqdn']]) # create flavor self.show_step(self.next_step) name = 'system_test-{}'.format(random.randint(10, 10000)) extra_specs_flavor = {'aggregate_instance_extra_specs:pinned': 'true', 'hw:cpu_policy': 'dedicated', 'hw:mem_page_size': 2048} pinned_cpus = int(settings.HARDWARE["slave_node_cpu"] / settings.HARDWARE["numa_nodes"]) flavor_id = random.randint(10, 10000) os_conn.create_flavor(name=name, ram=64, vcpus=pinned_cpus, disk=1, flavorid=flavor_id, extra_specs=extra_specs_flavor) self.show_step(self.next_step) net_name = self.fuel_web.get_cluster_predefined_networks_name( cluster_id)['private_net'] server1 = os_conn.create_server_for_migration(neutron=True, label=net_name, flavor=flavor_id) server2 = os_conn.create_server_for_migration(neutron=True, label=net_name, flavor=flavor_id) vms = {server1: None, server2: None} for server in vms: os_conn.verify_instance_status(server, 'ACTIVE') for server in vms: floating_ip = os_conn.assign_floating_ip(server) vms[server] = floating_ip logger.info("Floating address {0} associated with instance {1}" .format(floating_ip.ip, server.id)) for server, floating_ip in vms.items(): logger.info("Wait for ping from instance {} " "by floating ip".format(server.id)) devops_helpers.wait( # pylint: disable=undefined-loop-variable lambda: devops_helpers.tcp_ping(floating_ip.ip, 22), # pylint: enable=undefined-loop-variable timeout=700, timeout_msg=("Instance {0} is unreachable for {1} seconds". format(server.id, 300))) cirros_auth = SSHAuth(**settings.SSH_IMAGE_CREDENTIALS) slave_01_ssh = self.fuel_web.get_ssh_for_node("slave-01") self.show_step(self.next_step) for server, floating_ip in vms.items(): result = slave_01_ssh.execute_through_host( hostname=floating_ip.ip, cmd="sudo /sbin/ethtool -L eth0 combined {}".format( pinned_cpus), auth=cirros_auth) assert_equal( result.exit_code, 0, "Enabling queues using ethtool failed!\n{}".format(result)) self.show_step(self.next_step) result = slave_01_ssh.execute_through_host( hostname=floating_ip.ip, cmd="ls /sys/class/net/eth0/queues", auth=cirros_auth ) assert_equal(result.stdout_str.count("rx"), pinned_cpus, "RX queues count is not equal to vcpus count") assert_equal(result.stdout_str.count("tx"), pinned_cpus, "TX queues count is not equal to vcpus count") self.show_step(self.next_step) result = slave_01_ssh.execute_through_host( hostname=vms[server1].ip, cmd="ping -c 1 {}".format(vms[server2].ip), auth=cirros_auth) assert_equal( result.exit_code, 0, "Instances does not has connectivity between each other!")

commit_message:
neutron-lib: use L3 constant from neutron-lib

Ensure that the plugin uses the constant defined in neutron-lib.
L3_ROUTER_NAT will be dropped in favor of this. This change is in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/394164/.

NeutronLibImpact
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-lib

Change-Id: Id0dd492280911e79e07d92b5bbc78b25b318b733

commit_message:
Add manual installation guide

1. What is the problem?
We already have guides for users to install the Tricircle with DevStack.
But a guide discussing how to install the Tricircle step by step without
DevStack is also needed for users who install OpenStack manually.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Add manual installation guide, and link it to the Tricircle docs page.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
No new features

Change-Id: I45344df2ccb27c5096d66f00e4e76efa07d66012
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/25/394825/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =================== Manual Installation =================== In this guide we discuss how to manually install the Tricircle. The Tricircle depends on Keystone and Neutron, so please at least install these two services before you install the Tricircle. - 1 Install the Tricircle package:: git clone https://github.com/openstack/tricircle.git cd tricircle pip install -e . - 2 Register the Tricircle administrator API to Keystone:: openstack user create tricircle --password password openstack role add --project service --user tricircle service openstack service create tricircle --name tricircle --description "Cross Neutron Networking Automation Service" service_id=$(openstack service show tricircle -f value -c id) service_host=162.3.124.201 service_port=19999 service_region=CentralRegion service_url=http://$service_host:$service_port/v1.0 openstack endpoint create $service_id --publicurl $service_url --adminurl $service_url --internalurl $service_url --region $service_region change service_host, service_port and service_region in the above commands to adapt your deployment. - 3 Generate the Tricircle configuration sample:: cd tricircle oslo-config-generator --config-file=etc/api-cfg-gen.conf oslo-config-generator --config-file=etc/xjob-cfg-gen.conf The generated sample files are located in tricircle/etc - 4 Configure the Tricircle administrator API:: cd tricircle/etc cp api.conf.sample api.conf Edit etc/api.conf, for detail configuration information, please refer to the configuration guide. Below only options necessary to be changed are listed. .. csv-table:: :header: "Option", "Description", "Example" [DEFAULT] tricircle_db_connection, "database connection string for tricircle", mysql+pymysql://root:password@127.0.0.1/tricircle?charset=utf8 [keystone_authtoken] auth_type, "authentication method", password [keystone_authtoken] auth_url, "keystone authorization url", http://162.3.124.201/identity_admin [keystone_authtoken] username, "username of service account, needed for password authentication", tricircle [keystone_authtoken] password, "password of service account, needed for password authentication", password [keystone_authtoken] user_domain_name, "user domain name of service account, needed for password authentication", Default [keystone_authtoken] project_name, "project name of service account, needed for password authentication", service [keystone_authtoken] project_domain_name, "project domain name of service account, needed for password authentication", Default [keystone_authtoken] auth_uri, "complete public Identity API endpoint", http://162.3.124.201/identity [keystone_authtoken] cafile, "A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs", /opt/stack/data/ca-bundle.pem [keystone_authtoken] signing_dir, "Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens", /var/cache/tricircle [keystone_authtoken] memcached_servers, "Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for caching", 162.3.124.201:11211 [client] auth_url, "keystone authorization url", http://162.3.124.201:5000/v3 [client] identity_url, "keystone service url", http://162.3.124.201:35357/v3 [client] auto_refresh_endpoint, "if set to True, endpoint will be automatically refreshed if timeout accessing", True [client] top_pod_name, "name of central region which client needs to access", CentralRegion [client] admin_username, "username of admin account", admin [client] admin_password, "password of admin account", password [client] admin_tenant, "project name of admin account", demo [client] admin_user_domain_name, "user domain name of admin account", Default [client] admin_tenant_domain_name, "project name of admin account", Default - 5 Create the Tricircle database(take mysql as an example):: mysql -uroot -p -e "create database tricircle character set utf8;" cd tricircle python cmd/manage.py etc/api.conf - 6 Start the Tricircle administrator API:: sudo mkdir /var/cache/tricircle sudo chown $(whoami) /var/cache/tricircle/ cd tricircle python cmd/api.py --config-file etc/api.conf - 7 Configurate the Tricircle Xjob daemon:: cd tricircle/etc cp xjob.conf.sample xjob.conf Edit etc/xjob.conf, for detail configuration information, please refer to the configuration guide. Below only options necessary to be changed are listed. .. csv-table:: :header: "Option", "Description", "Example" [DEFAULT] tricircle_db_connection, "database connection string for tricircle", mysql+pymysql://root:password@127.0.0.1/tricircle?charset=utf8 [client] auth_url, "keystone authorization url", http://162.3.124.201:5000/v3 [client] identity_url, "keystone service url", http://162.3.124.201:35357/v3 [client] auto_refresh_endpoint, "if set to True, endpoint will be automatically refreshed if timeout accessing", True [client] top_pod_name, "name of central region which client needs to access", CentralRegion [client] admin_username, "username of admin account", admin [client] admin_password, "password of admin account", password [client] admin_tenant, "project name of admin account", demo [client] admin_user_domain_name, "user domain name of admin account", Default [client] admin_tenant_domain_name, "project name of admin account", Default - 8 Start the Tricircle Xjob daemon:: cd tricircle python cmd/xjob.py --config-file etc/xjob.conf - 9 Setup central Neutron server In this guide we assume readers have deployed local Neutron server, so we just briefly discuss the steps and extra configuration needed by central Neutron server. - configure central Neutron server edit neutron.conf .. csv-table:: :header: "Option", "Description", "Example" [database] connection, "database connection string for central Neutron server", mysql+pymysql://root:password@127.0.0.1/neutron?charset=utf8 [DEFAULT] bind_port, "Port central Neutron server binds to", 20001 [DEFAULT] core_plugin, "core plugin central Neutron server uses", tricircle.network.central_plugin.TricirclePlugin [DEFAULT] service_plugins, "service plugin central Neutron server uses", "(leave empty)" [DEFAULT] tricircle_db_connection, "database connection string for tricircle", mysql+pymysql://root:password@127.0.0.1/tricircle?charset=utf8 [client] auth_url, "keystone authorization url", http://162.3.124.201:5000/v3 [client] identity_url, "keystone service url", http://162.3.124.201:35357/v3 [client] auto_refresh_endpoint, "if set to True, endpoint will be automatically refreshed if timeout accessing", True [client] top_pod_name, "name of central region which client needs to access", CentralRegion [client] admin_username, "username of admin account", admin [client] admin_password, "password of admin account", password [client] admin_tenant, "project name of admin account", demo [client] admin_user_domain_name, "user domain name of admin account", Default [client] admin_tenant_domain_name, "project name of admin account", Default [tricircle] type_drivers, "list of network type driver entry points to be loaded", "local,shared_vlan" [tricircle] tenant_network_types, "ordered list of network_types to allocate as tenant networks", "local,shared_vlan" [tricircle] network_vlan_ranges, "physical_network names and VLAN tags range usable of VLAN provider", "bridge:2001:3000" [tricircle] bridge_network_type, "l3 bridge network type which is enabled in tenant_network_types and is not local type", shared_vlan [tricircle] enable_api_gateway, "whether the API gateway is enabled", False - create database for central Neutron server - register central Neutron server endpoint in Keystone, central Neutron should be registered in the same region with the Tricircle - start central Neutron server - 10 Setup local Neutron server - configure local Neutron server edit neutron.conf .. csv-table:: :header: "Option", "Description", "Example" [DEFAULT] core_plugin, "core plugin central Neutron server uses", tricircle.network.local_plugin.TricirclePlugin [client] auth_url, "keystone authorization url", http://162.3.124.201:5000/v3 [client] identity_url, "keystone service url", http://162.3.124.201:35357/v3 [client] auto_refresh_endpoint, "if set to True, endpoint will be automatically refreshed if timeout accessing", True [client] top_pod_name, "name of central region which client needs to access", CentralRegion [client] admin_username, "username of admin account", admin [client] admin_password, "password of admin account", password [client] admin_tenant, "project name of admin account", demo [client] admin_user_domain_name, "user domain name of admin account", Default [client] admin_tenant_domain_name, "project name of admin account", Default [tricircle] real_core_plugin, "the core plugin the Tricircle local plugin invokes", neutron.plugins.ml2.plugin.Ml2Plugin [tricircle] central_neutron_url, "central Neutron server url", http://162.3.124.201:20001 - restart local Neutron server

commit_message:
Replace LOG.warn with LOG.warning

1. What is the problem?
LOG.warn is deprecated in py3, we should use LOG.warning instead.[1]
2. What is the solution to the problem?
Use LOG.warning instead of LOG.warn, warning is functionally identical
to warn.
3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
No new features

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3.[1]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: Ic0a9b441ae779d69b63633bbda33071a742eb4c4

deleted_lines: LOG.warn(e.message + ', update endpoint and try again')

subject: Allow NotFound in update_attached_volume_with_nonexistent_volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-16 07:04:54.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_volumes_negative.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/d3ca2d88a70da3ad0d410c3baa639b33bb012db6', 'message': 'Allow NotFound in update_attached_volume_with_nonexistent_volume

In test_update_attached_volume_with_nonexistent_volume_in_body,
the testcase expects to raise lib_exc.BadRequest when volume in
body is nonexistent, but in some environments, lib_exc.NotFound
will be raised in this situation which generally speaking is
reasonable too.
So this is to let the testcase allowing not only BadRequest
but also NotFound exception.

commit_message:
Allow NotFound in update_attached_volume_with_nonexistent_volume

In test_update_attached_volume_with_nonexistent_volume_in_body,
the testcase expects to raise lib_exc.BadRequest when volume in
body is nonexistent, but in some environments, lib_exc.NotFound
will be raised in this situation which generally speaking is
reasonable too.
So this is to let the testcase allowing not only BadRequest
but also NotFound exception.

Change-Id: Icf98d328fd1d5bda8b316b8b6cc526c922bb98c7

subject: Fix resource deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 08:27:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/03eb6b02cd78422d0a0854de94f25febafadc148', 'message': "Fix resource deletion

1. What is the problem?
After introducing local plugin, some behaviours have been changed.
(1) Neutron resources created in local Neutron and central Neutron
    have the same ID
(2) Local plugin also needs to delete central port if the port
    belongs to Nova instance
(3) When handling get_ports request with ID filter, if port with
    requested ID is not found, local plugin will query central Neutron
    to retrieve port data with that ID and create a new port
This changes are not compatible with our previous resource deletion
procedure, thus resource deletion fails.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The following changes are included in this patch:
(1) Central plugin uses xjob to delete local ports of Nova instances,
    so we won't encounter loop deletion between local plugin and
    central plugin
(2) Local plugin only deletes central port if the port belongs to
    Nova instance
(3) Central plugin uses get_port to list ports if ID filter is given
(4) Use both bottom_id and top_id/pod_id to filter routing entries
    that need to be updated
(5) Local plugin checks token in context to distinguish whether the
    CRUD request is sent by HTTP or RPC. For requests sent by RPC,
    some operations need to be skipped.

3.What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
  to realize the solution?
Resources can be correctly deleted.

Change-Id: I5264bf867096f0dfefb90da1e56f1ce5e0a44e39

commit_message:
Fix resource deletion

1. What is the problem?
After introducing local plugin, some behaviours have been changed.
(1) Neutron resources created in local Neutron and central Neutron
    have the same ID
(2) Local plugin also needs to delete central port if the port
    belongs to Nova instance
(3) When handling get_ports request with ID filter, if port with
    requested ID is not found, local plugin will query central Neutron
    to retrieve port data with that ID and create a new port
These changes are not compatible with our previous resource deletion
procedure, thus resource deletion fails.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The following changes are included in this patch:
(1) Central plugin uses xjob to delete local ports of Nova instances,
    so we won't encounter loop deletion between local plugin and
    central plugin
(2) Local plugin only deletes central port if the port belongs to
    Nova instance
(3) Central plugin uses get_port to list ports if ID filter is given
(4) Use both bottom_id and top_id/pod_id to filter routing entries
    that need to be updated
(5) Local plugin checks token in context to distinguish whether the
    CRUD request is sent by HTTP or RPC. For requests sent by RPC,
    some operations need to be skipped.

3.What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
  to realize the solution?
Resources can be correctly deleted.

Change-Id: I5264bf867096f0dfefb90da1e56f1ce5e0a44e39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/97/406797/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import exceptions mapping[0]['pod_name'], subnet_id) try: mappings = db_api.get_bottom_mappings_by_top_id( t_ctx, port_id, t_constants.RT_PORT) if mappings: pod_id = mappings[0][0]['pod_id'] bottom_port_id = mappings[0][1] self.xjob_handler.delete_server_port(t_ctx, bottom_port_id, pod_id) except Exception: raise # Directly sending list request with "id" filter to local Neutron # server will cause problems. Because when local Neutron server # receives list request with "id" filter, it will query central # Neutron server and try to create the port. Here we introduce a # special handle for "id" filter if not filters or 'id' not in filters: # if filter is empty or "id" is not in the filter, no special # handle is required return self._get_ports(context, filters, fields, sorts, limit, marker, page_reverse) if len(filters) == 1: # only "id" is in the filter, we use get_port to get all the ports ports = [] for port_id in filters['id']: try: ports.append(self.get_port(context, port_id, fields)) except exceptions.PortNotFound: continue return ports else: # other filters are also specified, we first get the ports with # other filters, then filter the ports again with "id" id_filters = filters.pop('id') ports = self._get_ports(context, filters, None, sorts, limit, marker, page_reverse) return [super(TricirclePlugin, self)._fields( p, fields) for p in ports if p['id'] in id_filters] def _get_ports(self, context, filters=None, fields=None, sorts=None, limit=None, marker=None, page_reverse=False): 'value': resource_id}, {'key': 'top_id', 'comparator': 'eq', 'value': resource_name}],

commit_message:
Rename method 'format_labels' to 'format_args'

This method was used to format key-value arguments, including
'labels' and 'environment', so rename it to be accurate.
