commit_message:
Add '--type'and other options to network rbac list

This patch adds '--type','--action','--long' filtering options
to network rbac list command

Change-Id: I21846820ab223bb7832e89eb2d7658bbec271aec
Closes-Bug: #1648307
Partially-Implements: blueprint network-commands-options
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/53/408453/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: columns_long = ( 'ID', 'Object Type', 'Object ID', 'Action', ) data_long = [] for r in rbac_policies: data_long.append(( r.id, r.object_type, r.object_id, r.action, )) def test_network_rbac_list_type_opt(self): arglist = [ '--type', self.rbac_policies[0].object_type, ] verifylist = [ ('type', self.rbac_policies[0].object_type)] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.network.rbac_policies.assert_called_with(**{ 'object_type': self.rbac_policies[0].object_type }) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, list(data)) def test_network_rbac_list_action_opt(self): arglist = [ '--action', self.rbac_policies[0].action, ] verifylist = [ ('action', self.rbac_policies[0].action)] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # DisplayCommandBase.take_action() returns two tuples columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.network.rbac_policies.assert_called_with(**{ 'action': self.rbac_policies[0].action }) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data, list(data)) def test_network_rbac_list_with_long(self): arglist = [ '--long', ] verifylist = [ ('long', True), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.network.rbac_policies.assert_called_with() self.assertEqual(self.columns_long, columns) self.assertEqual(self.data_long, list(data))

commit_message:
Add OSC Plugin for openstack appcontainer create

This change implements the "openstack appcontainer create" command
 Based on existing zun command: zun create

Partially Implements:blueprint zun-osc-plugin

Change-Id: I1967745798c4ae84da8f33e318a41ee9714e3511
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zunclient refs/changes/53/414253/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from zunclient.common import cliutils from zunclient.common import utils as zun_utils from zunclient.i18n import _class CreateContainer(command.ShowOne): """Create a container""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".CreateContainer") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(CreateContainer, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( '--name', metavar='<name>', help='name of the container') parser.add_argument( '--image', required=True, metavar='<image>', help='name or ID of the image') parser.add_argument( '--command', metavar='<command>', help='Send command to the container') parser.add_argument( '--cpu', metavar='<cpu>', help='The memory of virtual cpus.') parser.add_argument( '--memory', metavar='<memory>', help='The container memory size (format: <number><optional unit>, ' 'where unit = b, k, m or g)') parser.add_argument( '--environment', metavar='<KEY=VALUE>', action='append', default=[], help='The environment variabled') parser.add_argument( '--workdir', metavar='<workdir>', help='The working directory for commands to run in') parser.add_argument( '--expose', metavar='<port>', action='append', default=[], help='A port or a list of ports to expose. ' 'May be used multiple times.') parser.add_argument( '--hostname', metavar='<hostname>', help='The hostname to use for the container') parser.add_argument( '--label', metavar='<KEY=VALUE>', action='append', default=[], help='Adds a map of labels to a container. ' 'May be used multiple times.') parser.add_argument( '--image-pull-policy', dest='image_pull_policy', metavar='<policy>', choices=['never', 'always', 'ifnotpresent'], help='The policy which determines if the image should ' 'be pulled prior to starting the container. ' 'It can have following values: ' '"ifnotpresent": only pull the image if it does not ' 'already exist on the node. ' '"always": Always pull the image from repositery.' '"never": never pull the image') return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = _get_client(self, parsed_args) opts = {} opts['name'] = parsed_args.name opts['image'] = parsed_args.image opts['command'] = parsed_args.command opts['memory'] = parsed_args.memory opts['cpu'] = parsed_args.cpu opts['environment'] = zun_utils.format_labels(parsed_args.environment) opts['workdir'] = parsed_args.workdir opts['ports'] = parsed_args.expose opts['hostname'] = parsed_args.hostname opts['labels'] = zun_utils.format_labels(parsed_args.label) opts['image_pull_policy'] = parsed_args.image_pull_policy container = client.containers.create(**opts) columns = _container_columns(container) return columns, utils.get_item_properties(container, columns)

commit_message:
--expose option removed as it is not supported

The reason is that we passed --net=none when creating
a Docker container. Therefore, --expose is not supported
anymore.

Closes-Bug: #1650964

Change-Id: I19838d86f6f23bc7d279370b6351b5b01d3de37f

commit_message:
Display selected panel name on browser title bar

This patch is addressing the change of below.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409753/7

Currently, when using anuglar table, the name of title bar on
browser is always 'Horizon - xxx' and it's bad usability for users.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I9b3fedd2f41b275af6f255f2aaa44052a7d7f7cb

commit_message:
Remove mox in tests/unit/objects/test_security_group

This patch replaces mox with mock in
tests/unit/objects/test_security_group

Partially-Implements: blueprint remove-mox-ocata

Change-Id: I78395e21615b77fa5c55a5f374255f6f17937a76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/307135/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_get') def test_get(self, get_mock): get_mock.return_value = fake_secgroup @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_get_by_name') def test_get_by_name(self, get_mock): get_mock.return_value = fake_secgroup @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_in_use') def test_in_use(self, inuse_mock): inuse_mock.return_value = True @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_update') def test_save(self, update_mock): update_mock.return_value = updated_secgroup @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_update') def test_save_no_changes(self, update_mock): @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_get') def test_refresh(self, mock_get): mock_get.return_value = updated_secgroup @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_get_all') def test_get_all(self, get_mock): get_mock.return_value = fake_secgroups @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_get_by_project') def test_get_by_project(self, mock_get): mock_get.return_value = fake_secgroups @mock.patch.object(db, 'security_group_get_by_instance') def test_get_by_instance(self, get_mock): get_mock.return_value = fake_secgroups
deleted_lines: def test_get(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_get') db.security_group_get(self.context, 1).AndReturn(fake_secgroup) self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_get_by_name(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_get_by_name') db.security_group_get_by_name(self.context, 'fake-project', 'fake-name').AndReturn(fake_secgroup) self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_in_use(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_in_use') db.security_group_in_use(self.context, 123).AndReturn(True) self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_save(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_update') db.security_group_update(self.context, 1, {'description': 'foobar'}).AndReturn( updated_secgroup) self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_save_no_changes(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_update') self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_refresh(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_get') db.security_group_get(self.context, 1).AndReturn(updated_secgroup) self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_get_all(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_get_all') db.security_group_get_all(self.context).AndReturn(fake_secgroups) self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_get_by_project(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_get_by_project') db.security_group_get_by_project(self.context, 'fake-project').AndReturn( fake_secgroups) self.mox.ReplayAll() def test_get_by_instance(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(db, 'security_group_get_by_instance') db.security_group_get_by_instance(self.context, 'fake-inst-uuid').AndReturn( fake_secgroups) self.mox.ReplayAll()

Improve error message for Json field validation

This patch improves the exception message when coercing an invalid value
into Json value.

Change-Id: Ied53935042ad9c5faa1de6ec2726fb5a60862bbd

deleted_lines: except Exception: # TODO(Anyone): emit a useful message here. raise ValueError

commit_message:
Skip docutils 0.13.1

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs
when it tries to build docs with remote images.
This has been reported upstream[0]. The version
matches the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: I7fb8c0fa9518b6b16eba6f7c5607c94136ebca53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs refs/changes/88/414788/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Modify the description of profile validate

The spec file should be of the profile to be validated, not created,
which is copied from profile create.

Change-Id: Id697a2db2c9e98e7977f9d39b6a3877ee1a5ce83

deleted_lines: :param name: The name for the profile to be created.

Trivial: fix the parameter description error in _validate_policy

Parameter "name" in _validate_policy should be the name of the
policy to be validated.

commit_message:
Rename interface to endpoint_type

'interface' argument was not described anywhere in novaclient's docs,
but since we transmit all additional (unexpected) arguments to
SessionClient implementation, keystoneclient was able to use it.

Change-Id: Id7200a6df416694173b9a02206c53cef984f0fec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/99/406299/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: interface=endpoint_type, # NOTE(andreykurilin): OpenStack projects use two variables with one # meaning: 'endpoint_type' and 'interface'. 'endpoint_type' is an old # name which was used by most OpenStack clients. Later it was replaced by # 'interface' in keystone and later some other clients switched to new # variable name too. In case of novaclient, there is no need to switch to # 'interface' variable name due too several reasons: # - novaclient uses 'endpoint_type' variable name long time ago and # there is no real reasons to switch to new name; # - 'interface' argument is used in several shell subcommands # (for example in `nova floating-ip-bulk-create`), so we will need to # modify these subcommands to not conflict with global flag # 'interface' # Actually, novaclient did not accept 'interface' before, but since we # allow additional arguments(kwargs), someone can use this variable name # and face issue about unexpected behavior. _check_arguments(kwargs, "Ocata", "interface", "endpoint_type")

commit_message:
[glossary] Consolodate project codenames [vitrage]

- Add "Root Cause Analysis (RCA) service (Vitrage)" entry.
  - Link "vitrage" to "Root Cause Analysis (RCA) service (Vitrage)"
  - Make sure description matches project.yaml

Change-Id: Ie32b8c31d471535b49e23bcc7f3e33ca429d68c1
Implements: bp improve-glossary-usage
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/85/414185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Root Cause Analysis (RCA) service (Vitrage) OpenStack project that aims to organize, analyze and visualize OpenStack alarms and events, yield insights regarding the root cause of problems and deduce their existence before they are directly detected. Vitrage Code name for the :term:`Root Cause Analysis service <Root Cause Analysis (RCA) service (Vitrage)>`.

Cette page contient la liste des documentations OpenStack disponibles en version française.

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-12-24 09:26+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-12-24 11:13+0000\n""A Compute component that provides dnsmasq and radvd and sets up forwarding " "to and from cloudpipe instances." msgstr "" "Компонент службы вычислительных ресурсов, который обеспечивает работу " "сервера dnsmasq и демона radvd, а также настраивает маршрутизацию с " "инстансами cloudpipe." #, fuzzy msgid "" "A Compute component that provides users access to the consoles of their VM " "instances through VNC or VMRC." msgstr "" "Компонент службы вычислительных ресурсов, который обеспечивает пользователям " "доступ к консолям их инстансов ВМ через VNC или VMRC." #, fuzzy msgid ""msgid "" "A generic term for virtualization of network functions such as switching, " "routing, load balancing, and security using a combination of VMs and " "overlays on physical network infrastructure." msgstr "" "Общий термин, означающий виртуализацию сетевых функций, таких как " "коммутация, маршрутизация, балансировка нагрузки и безопасность с " "использованием сочетания виртуальных машин и оверлейных сетей на основе " "физической сетевой инфраструктуры." msgid "" "A network virtualization technology that attempts to reduce the scalability " "problems associated with large cloud computing deployments. It uses a VLAN-" "like encapsulation technique to encapsulate Ethernet frames within UDP " "packets." msgstr "" "Технология сетевой виртуализации, созданной для решения проблем " "масштабируемости в больших системах облачных вычислений. Она использует " "схожий с VLAN метод инкапсуляции Ethernet-кадров в UDP-пакеты." #, fuzzy#, fuzzy msgid "Alternative term for a VM or guest." msgstr "Альтернативный термин для виртуальной машины или гостевой ОС." #, fuzzy msgid "Alternative term for a virtual network." msgstr "Альтернативный термин для виртуальной сети." msgid "Alternative term for an image." msgstr "Альтернативный термин для образа." #, fuzzymsgid "" "An Internet Protocol (IP) address configured on the load balancer for use by " "clients connecting to a service that is load balanced. Incoming connections " "are distributed to back-end nodes based on the configuration of the load " "balancer." msgstr "" "IP-адрес, настроенный на балансировщике нагрузки для использования " "клиентами, подключающимися к службе с функцией балансировки нагрузки. " "Входящие подключения распределяются по внутренним узлам на основе " "конфигурации балансировщика нагрузки." #, fuzzy msgid "An L2 network segment within Networking." msgstr "Сетевой сегмент уровня L2 в службе управления сетями." #, fuzzy"An interface that is plugged into a port in a Networking network. Typically " "a virtual network interface belonging to a VM." msgstr "" "Интерфейс, подключаемый в порт в сети службы Networking. Обычно виртуальный " "сетевой интерфейс виртуальный машины." #, fuzzy msgid ""msgid "" "An operating system instance that runs on top of a hypervisor. Multiple VMs " "can run at the same time on the same physical host." msgstr "" "Инстанс операционной системы, который выполняется поверх гипервизора. На " "одном физическом хосте одновременно могут выполняться несколько ВМ." #, fuzzymsgid "" "Attachment point where a virtual interface connects to a virtual network." msgstr "Точка подключения виртуального интерфейса к виртуальной сети." "Method to access VM instance consoles using a web browser. Supported by " "Compute." msgstr "" "Метод доступа к консолям инстансов ВМ с помощью веб-браузера. Поддерживается " "службой вычислительных ресурсов." #, fuzzy msgid """Open source GUI and CLI tools used for remote console access to VMs. " "Supported by Compute." msgstr "" "Инструменты пользовательского интерфейса и командной строки с открытым " "исходным кодом, которые используются для удаленного доступа с консоли к ВМ. " "Поддерживаются службой вычислительных ресурсов." #, fuzzy msgid ""#, fuzzy msgid "" "Provided by Compute in the form of cloudpipes, specialized instances that " "are used to create VPNs on a per-project basis." msgstr "" "Предоставляется службой вычислительных ресурсов в виде программных VPN " "(cloudpipe) — специализированных инстансов, которые используются для " "создания сетей VPN для отдельных проектов." msgid "Provides support for VMware NSX in Neutron." msgstr "Обеспечивает поддержку VMware NSX в Neutron." #, fuzzymsgid "" "Software that runs on a host or node and provides the features and functions " "of a hardware-based network switch." msgstr "" "Программное обеспечение, которое работает на конечном устройстве или узле и " "предоставляет возможности и функции аппаратного сетевого коммуникатора" msgid "Supports interaction with VMware products in Compute." msgstr "" "Поддерживает взаимодействие с продуктами VMware в службе вычислительных " "ресурсов." #, fuzzy"have a public and private network interface. commit_message:
Remove redundant parentheses in volumes_client

Origin writing way is prompted with wavy lines in the editor like
Pycharm highlights redundant parentheses. This patch change it to
a more appropriate way.

Change-Id: I27772ec6f1aaeb2736389375fba25608bd1eb945

commit_message:
Windows connectors: add device_scan_interval arg

The Hyper-V Nova driver will pass os-brick the device rescan
interval. This change indends to honor this for the Windows
connectors.

Other connectors use either a fixed rescan interval, either a
exponentially growing interval. If needed, this patch can be
updated so that other connectors may use this argument as well.

Change-Id: I3d6b4ed2ac27269241420ca03ec7075a977e86e8

commit_message:
Fix the status parameters in api-ref

This patch fixes the "status" in all inc files.
Subsequent patchsets will improve the description of other parameters in
the api-ref.

Change-Id: I5f07550bf923c1b7c6defd2e8b2b39c9cd397544
Partial-Bug: #1649557

commit_message:
Change passing session to context in segments db functions

We have a number of functions that expect to get session as one
the arguments. Passing session is not correct and this prevents
of usage new enginefacade which expect context to be passed and
session will be injected in current context.

This change is based on change in Neutron, so here all affected
places are fixed to pass context.

Switched to use updated ML2TypeDriver.

Depends-On: I68ac442f11a6698bc43210fae877ba3809b1c02d

Partially-Implements blueprint: enginefacade-switch

Change-Id: I19e226b1633b068693ae40a8257c4fac41bb80ad

commit_message:
Trivial: remove two TODO items

The docker profile is already improved to validate host info; the
message driver of event is already enabled to filter events based on
level. This patch removes the two TODO items we left before.

Change-Id: I6829eaed5677cdc95a1d35cf1f886834b5fceda1

subject: It's possible to authenticate through the Admin API.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2011-07-26 17:43:47.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/test_tokens.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/24eaa68d2cd535bfb4b5db9c54c67d1d806b2564', 'message': "It's possible to authenticate through the Admin API.

Note: Had to add more dependencies because Keystone returns extant
tokens, so we have to be very careful about ordering of token
revocations.  This shouldn't affect anything that extends
base.KeystoneTest--all that can still run in parallel--but the
test_adminauth() has to be a dependency of
base.KeystoneTest.setUpClass() and has to be dependent on
test_authenticate() so we serialize things properly.
"}]
commit_message:
It's possible to authenticate through the Admin API.

Note: Had to add more dependencies because Keystone returns extant
tokens, so we have to be very careful about ordering of token
revocations.  This shouldn't affect anything that extends
base.KeystoneTest--all that can still run in parallel--but the
test_adminauth() has to be a dependency of
base.KeystoneTest.setUpClass() and has to be dependent on
test_authenticate() so we serialize things properly.
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/67/67/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @dtest.depends(test_authenticate) def test_adminauth(self): """Test that we can authenticate using Keystone Admin API.""" # Issue the authentication request resp = self.ks_admin.authenticate(base.options.adminuser, base.options.adminpass) # Verify that resp is correct util.assert_equal(resp.status, 200) util.assert_in('auth', resp.obj) util.assert_in('token', resp.obj['auth']) util.assert_in('expires', resp.obj['auth']['token']) util.assert_in('id', resp.obj['auth']['token']) # Squirrel away the admin token ID admin_tok = resp.obj['auth']['token']['id'] # Now ensure we can revoke an authentication token resp = self.ks_admin.revoke_token(admin_tok, admin_tok) util.assert_equal(resp.status, 204) dtest.depends(AuthenticateTest.test_authenticate, AuthenticateTest.test_adminauth)(base.KeystoneTest.setUpClass)

added_lines: ## a Keystone authentication token in self.token and API accessors in ## self.ks and self.ks_admin. See ksapi.py for a list of what methods ## are available on self.ks/self.ks_admin.## self.user_tok, self.ks, self.admin_tok, and self.ks_admin. If you ## override setUp(), make sure you call the superclass's setUp() ## method (it's responsible for setting self.ks and self.ks_admin). ## Try to avoid overriding setUpClass() or tearDownClass() if you can ## help it (they're responsible for setting up and destroying ## self.admin_tok and self.user_tok). resp = self.ks.sample_call(self.user_tok, 'argument 1', 'argument 2')
deleted_lines: ## a Keystone authentication token in self.token and an API accessor ## in self.ks. See ksapi.py for a list of what methods are available ## on self.ks.## self.token and self.ks. If you override setUp(), make sure you ## call the superclass's setUp() method (it's responsible for setting ## self.ks). Try to avoid overriding setUpClass() or tearDownClass() ## if you can help it (they're responsible for setting up and ## destroying self.token). resp = self.ks.sample_call(self.token, 'argument 1', 'argument 2')

commit_message:
Fix devstack default

Set dragonflow config path to /etc/neutron to run with enabled neutron services

Set Q_PLUGIN_EXTRA_CONF_FILES to the relative path according to [1] and when
neutron services enables (i.e. lbaas) it gets set to /etc/neutron by services
[1] _configure_neutron_common function at
     https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/neutron-legacy

Change-Id: I6af0005b994dbead4f78ca219de9b1953225c9d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/64/413964/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Q_PLUGIN_EXTRA_CONF_FILES=(plugins/dragonflow.ini)

commit_message:
Remove Duplicate line in privsep.filters

Only one line is picked up by configparser, so we should just
have one in the default privsep.filters file. This was found when
a stricter configparser kicked in for a python3.5 test.

Closes-Bug: #1652157
Change-Id: Ib7d9aa0e0b74a936002e0eea0b3af05102b06a62

commit_message:
Use assertGreater(len(x), 0) instead of assertTrue(len(x) > 0)

assertGreater provides a nicer error message if it fails.

Change-Id: I497a028903c70d7734573d73674059440901ffef

commit_message:
Refactor flows

Refactor flows:
  - rename flows into a short-name logical operations
  - rename all 'restoration' into 'restore'

Change-Id: Ib676508b14b114a24c370e70f8e375d41239a973

commit_message:
Make evacuate target_host not required

Nova api can auto select target_host to evacuate,
So we should make target_host required=False.

Change-Id: I68c497502db70a3a360e6e79871efd038dc974a4

commit_message:
devref: suggest bug deputies to send brief reports to ML

Often times, team meetings occur in times inconvenient for a serving bug
deputy to join. In which case, we may miss a valuable weekly report. In
that case, suggest to send the report in advance to openstack-dev@.

Change-Id: If4852e3b90e51fb71e39ced4bfaaca052a095b59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/21/413121/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: meeting and tracked in the meeting notes. If for some reason the deputy is not going to attend the team meeting to report, the deputy should consider sending a brief report to the openstack-dev@ mailing list in advance of the meeting.
deleted_lines: meeting and tracked in the meeting notes.

commit_message:
Using RBAC for create and modify packages public checkbox

When create and modify packages, using RBAC to control the public checkbox.
without the policy, the checkbox will readonly and disabled.

Change-Id: I4974eff4910b78e637d4d7c085d9fa0e04ded5d1
Closes-Bug: #1618266
Implements: blueprint murano-dashboard-rbac

commit_message:
Using rbac policy for images panel

Since murano didn't have mark_image and remove_mark_image policy,
So add it for dashboard policy, let the images panel can use the rbac
policy.

Change-Id: I9b69a6ec45f2671a61cb941443c06ed632a4374e
Closes-Bug: #1621054
Implements: blueprint murano-dashboard-rbac

added_lines: from openstack_dashboard import policy policy_rules = (("murano", "mark_image"),) class RemoveImageMetadata(policy.PolicyTargetMixin, tables.DeleteAction): policy_rules = (("murano", "remove_mark_image"),)
deleted_lines: def allowed(self, request, image): return request.user.is_superuser class RemoveImageMetadata(tables.DeleteAction): def allowed(self, request, image): return request.user.is_superuser

commit_message:
Add Try/Exception block to get_image and get_supplier_image

When app's logo missing, it will cause the exception when get log
and get supplier log, This patch add Try/Exception block for this
two function.

Closes-bug: #1619532
Change-Id: I3d646f08a8674ee9ef6969c7e9d29e9610fb0d7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/64/364664/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: content = pkg_api.get_app_logo(request, app_id) except Exception: message = _("Can not get logo for {0}.").format(app_id) LOG.warning(message) content = None try: content = pkg_api.get_app_supplier_logo(request, app_id) except Exception: message = _("Can not get supplier logo for {0}.").format(app_id) LOG.warning(message) content = None
deleted_lines: content = pkg_api.get_app_logo(request, app_id) content = pkg_api.get_app_supplier_logo(request, app_id)

commit_message:
Skip docutils version 13.1

docutils version 13.1 is causing issues with remote images.
We will be skipping version 13.1, until the docutils bug [1] will be
resolved.

[1] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: Id9d694ba8b94e8fc39c3fb9681daaf29ab3da435
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor-dashboard refs/changes/95/413995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-karborclient.

Change-Id: Ib7f5194b7cf04917d8cfd3e7e1dafc303e234d20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-karborclient refs/changes/82/413382/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Node do_operation support

This adds 'do_operation' method to Node class which can be used to
invoke profile-specific operations.

Change-Id: I87aa16b9cdfd66b107102091ec29b44710d34faf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/02/414702/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def do_operation(self, context, **inputs): """Perform an operation on a node. :param context: The request context. :param dict inputs: The operation and parameters if any. :returns: A boolean indicating whether the operation was a success. """ if not self.physical_id: return False op = inputs['operation'] params = inputs.get('params', {}) self.set_status(context, consts.NS_OPERATING, reason=_("Operation '%s' in progress") % op) try: profile = self.rt['profile'] method = getattr(profile, 'handle_' + op) method(context, self, **params) except exc.EResourceOperation as ex: self.set_status(context, consts.NS_ERROR, reason=six.text_type(ex)) return False self.set_status(context, consts.NS_ACTIVE, reason=_("Operation '%s' succeeded") % op) return True

commit_message:
Improve Operation schema validation

This patch adds validation support to operation schema.

Change-Id: I25b5d412de817f803759e9b64dbab775423b47c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/01/414701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate(self, value): if not isinstance(value, six.string_types): raise TypeError("value is not a string") self.validate_constraints(value) def validate(self, data, version=None): for k in data: if k not in self.schema: msg = _("Unrecognizable parameter '%s'") % k raise exc.ESchema(message=msg) for (k, s) in self.schema.items(): try: if k in data: s.validate(data[k]) elif s.required: msg = _("Required parameter '%s' not provided") % k raise exc.ESchema(message=msg) if version: s._validate_version(k, version) except (TypeError, ValueError) as ex: raise exc.ESchema(message=six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Remove unused variables from unit test method

The method signature for _http_idp_input() in test_v3_federation.py
accepted all kwargs passed to it, and did some logic with them. It
turns out that nothing ever passes kwargs to that method, so I
removed that case and simplified the method signature.

Change-Id: I72b7e7fb29c10f51e174cbd2516ddd5610cedbda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/57/414257/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _http_idp_input(self): """Create default input dictionary for IdP data.""" body = self.default_body.copy() body['description'] = uuid.uuid4().hex
deleted_lines: def _http_idp_input(self, **kwargs): """Create default input for IdP data.""" body = None if 'body' not in kwargs: body = self.default_body.copy() body['description'] = uuid.uuid4().hex else: body = kwargs['body']

subject: Fix cmd execution stderr, stdout unicode errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 11:20:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/e0db0e2903b8b6afc998391e6e390f689908c96d', 'message': "Fix cmd execution stderr, stdout unicode errors

If we run a command that returns non ascii character on stdout or stderr
using _execute attribute from Executor class or any of the inheriting
classes and we try to use stdout or stderr in the logs without decoding
it first, it will results in an exception like:

 UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position
 19: ordinal not in range(128)

In existing code this can happen in quite a lot of places, and not only
where we are logging an error but also when we are logging progress or
debug information.

For example when running dd we could get in stdout:

 1+0 registros leídos
 1+0 registros escritos
 512 bytes (512 B) copiados, 0,000368406 s, 1,4 MB/s

Instead of decoding stdout and stderr whenever we want to use them, this
patch takes another approach, capturing ProcessExecutionError exceptions
and converting string field to unicode and converting returned values of
the execution as well.  That way we can safely use the exception
contents and returned values anywhere in the code.

Closes-Bug: #1602346
Change-Id: I46d8a47ae4f638dbb4b0dc125008bceb0f29fa15

commit_message:
Fix cmd execution stderr, stdout unicode errors

If we run a command that returns non ascii character on stdout or stderr
using _execute attribute from Executor class or any of the inheriting
classes and we try to use stdout or stderr in the logs without decoding
it first, it will results in an exception like:

 UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position
 19: ordinal not in range(128)

In existing code this can happen in quite a lot of places, and not only
where we are logging an error but also when we are logging progress or
debug information.

For example when running dd we could get in stdout:

 1+0 registros leídos
 1+0 registros escritos
 512 bytes (512 B) copiados, 0,000368406 s, 1,4 MB/s

Instead of decoding stdout and stderr whenever we want to use them, this
patch takes another approach, capturing ProcessExecutionError exceptions
and converting string field to unicode and converting returned values of
the execution as well.  That way we can safely use the exception
contents and returned values anywhere in the code.

Closes-Bug: #1602346
Change-Id: I46d8a47ae4f638dbb4b0dc125008bceb0f29fa15
(cherry picked from commit a9f50dd3823ea2e9c568a1fdd970e268955dca9f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/66/406066/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_concurrency import processutils as putils from oslo_utils import encodeutils @staticmethod def safe_decode(string): return string and encodeutils.safe_decode(string, errors='ignore') @classmethod def make_putils_error_safe(cls, exc): """Converts ProcessExecutionError string attributes to unicode.""" for field in ('stderr', 'stdout', 'cmd', 'description'): value = getattr(exc, field, None) if value: setattr(exc, field, cls.safe_decode(value)) def _execute(self, *args, **kwargs): try: result = self.__execute(*args, **kwargs) if result: result = (self.safe_decode(result[0]), self.safe_decode(result[1])) return result except putils.ProcessExecutionError as e: self.make_putils_error_safe(e) raise def set_execute(self, execute): self.__execute = execute

commit_message:
Backup project attribute support

Cinder has supported to query project id of volume
and snapshot, for consistency, this will introduce
backup project attribute in querying operation.

APIImpact
Add 'os-backup-project-attr:project_id: xxxx' in querying
response.

Implements: blueprint: backup-tenant-attribute-support
Change-Id: I6fde17baffe88ab4d4e69dcc2fefdbcb8d7a4dc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/74/258374/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from cinder.api import extensions from cinder.api.openstack import wsgi from cinder.api import xmlutil authorize = extensions.soft_extension_authorizer('backup', 'backup_tenant_attribute') class BackupTenantAttributeController(wsgi.Controller): def _add_backup_tenant_attribute(self, req, resp_backup): db_backup = req.get_db_backup(resp_backup['id']) key = "%s:tenant_id" % Backup_tenant_attribute.alias resp_backup[key] = db_backup['project_id'] @wsgi.extends def show(self, req, resp_obj, id): context = req.environ['cinder.context'] if authorize(context): resp_obj.attach(xml=BackupTenantAttributeTemplate()) backup = resp_obj.obj['backup'] self._add_backup_tenant_attribute(req, backup) @wsgi.extends def detail(self, req, resp_obj): context = req.environ['cinder.context'] if authorize(context): resp_obj.attach(xml=BackupListTenantAttributeTemplate()) for bak in list(resp_obj.obj['backups']): self._add_backup_tenant_attribute(req, bak) class Backup_tenant_attribute(extensions.ExtensionDescriptor): """Expose the internal project_id as an attribute of a backup.""" name = "BackupTenantAttribute" alias = "os-bak-tenant-attr" namespace = ("http://docs.openstack.org/volume/ext/" "backup_tenant_attribute/api/v2") updated = "2011-11-03T00:00:00+00:00" def get_controller_extensions(self): controller = BackupTenantAttributeController() extension = extensions.ControllerExtension(self, 'backups', controller) return [extension] def make_backup(elem): elem.set('{%s}tenant_id' % Backup_tenant_attribute.namespace, '%s:tenant_id' % Backup_tenant_attribute.alias) class BackupTenantAttributeTemplate(xmlutil.TemplateBuilder): def construct(self): root = xmlutil.TemplateElement('backup', selector='backup') make_backup(root) alias = Backup_tenant_attribute.alias namespace = Backup_tenant_attribute.namespace return xmlutil.SlaveTemplate(root, 1, nsmap={alias: namespace}) class BackupListTenantAttributeTemplate(xmlutil.TemplateBuilder): def construct(self): root = xmlutil.TemplateElement('backups') elem = xmlutil.SubTemplateElement(root, 'backup', selector='backups') make_backup(elem) alias = Backup_tenant_attribute.alias namespace = Backup_tenant_attribute.namespace return xmlutil.SlaveTemplate(root, 1, nsmap={alias: namespace})

commit_message:
Pass kwarg 'fail_formatter' conditionally

Commit ca43430680bacbba7a17d5fde88aa253a7229c68 used the kwarg
‘fail_formatter’ to suppress traceback for InvalidInput and
QuotaError exceptions. But ‘fail_formatter’ was introduced
only in taskflow 2.7.0. Therefore, volume create will fail
if taskflow version is less than 2.7.0; the minimum required
taskflow version for Cinder is 1.26.0.

This patch checks the taskflow version and sets the member
variable ‘_fail_formatter’ in DynamicLoggingListener for
versions less than 2.7.0 to fix the issue.

Closes-bug: #1651708
Change-Id: I537b4779d5f7289bcc1a90b8130a612c76a27759
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/88/413588/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
encryptors: Mock os_brick.executor correctly

Previously the encryptor test classes would mock the privileged rootwrap
executor directly in the setUp method of each class. This will
potentially race and is not required when mocking out execute calls
within os_brick.

This change also introduces a BaseEncryptorTestCase test class to avoid
duplicate runs of the various get_encryptors test methods.

Conflicts:
        os_brick/tests/encryptors/test_base.py
        os_brick/tests/encryptors/test_cryptsetup.py
        os_brick/tests/encryptors/test_luks.py

Change-Id: I170fbcc07672c9c77b613c1eb84bcefbcd42ce77
(cherry picked from commit 6f1bb596dcde9424bc5d4c16b9bd24a88c371050)

deleted_lines: def _create(self, root_helper, connection_info, keymgr, execute): return nop.NoOpEncryptor(root_helper=root_helper, connection_info=connection_info, keymgr=keymgr, execute=execute)

commit_message:
Fix python3 issues with devstack

etree.tostring() needs to be massaged before calling libvirt's
baselineCPU or we will end up with a problem. This can be easily
recreated using:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/593069/
the fix was tested using:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/593070/

We need to send bytes to Popen.communicate under python3:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/subprocess.html?highlight=communicate#subprocess.Popen.communicate

Change-Id: I0ec47f99be8c3e4cb5ac5a6f7343354cc2de380c

subject: encryptors: Workaround mangled passphrases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 11:20:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/1593250ce5413dd6fbe4650b407ab889336bf8de', 'message': "encryptors: Workaround mangled passphrases

Prior to Ib563b0ea the passphrase used by CryptsetupEncryptor and
LuksEncryptor had any leading zeros per hexadecimal digit removed, for
example 0x04 or 04 would turn into 0x4 or 4. As a result any volume
encrypted prior to the release of Newton used a modified passphrase that
was different to that stored by the key manager being used in the
environment.

To correct this for LuksEncryptor volumes permission denied errors are
now caught when attempting to open a volume. A second attempt to open
the volume is then made using a mangled passphrase. If successful the
correct passphrase is then added to the volume before the mangled
passphrase is finally removed. This workaround can be removed in a
future release once it is safe to assume that all LuksEncryptor volumes
have had any mangled passphrases replaced in this way.

This isn't possible for CryptsetupEncryptor volumes as the plain mode
used by cryptsetup does not provide a way for adding and removing keys.
As such on a permission denied error a second attempt is made to open
the volume using a mangled passphrase. Unlike the above workaround this
cannot be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: I7096463c5eba951dd6322ee6965435e877ca0371
Partial-bug: #1633518
(cherry picked from commit 7e33521a39d5b7478008e5d6ba4c754857edbee9)

commit_message:
encryptors: Workaround mangled passphrases

Prior to Ib563b0ea the passphrase used by CryptsetupEncryptor and
LuksEncryptor had any leading zeros per hexadecimal digit removed, for
example 0x04 or 04 would turn into 0x4 or 4. As a result any volume
encrypted prior to the release of Newton used a modified passphrase that
was different to that stored by the key manager being used in the
environment.

To correct this for LuksEncryptor volumes permission denied errors are
now caught when attempting to open a volume. A second attempt to open
the volume is then made using a mangled passphrase. If successful the
correct passphrase is then added to the volume before the mangled
passphrase is finally removed. This workaround can be removed in a
future release once it is safe to assume that all LuksEncryptor volumes
have had any mangled passphrases replaced in this way.

This isn't possible for CryptsetupEncryptor volumes as the plain mode
used by cryptsetup does not provide a way for adding and removing keys.
As such on a permission denied error a second attempt is made to open
the volume using a mangled passphrase. Unlike the above workaround this
cannot be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: I7096463c5eba951dd6322ee6965435e877ca0371
Partial-bug: #1633518
(cherry picked from commit 7e33521a39d5b7478008e5d6ba4c754857edbee9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/68/406068/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import arrayfrom os_brick.i18n import _LW, _LI def _get_mangled_passphrase(self, key): """Convert the raw key into a list of unsigned int's and then a string """ # NOTE(lyarwood): This replicates the methods used prior to Newton to # first encode the passphrase as a list of unsigned int's before # decoding back into a string. This method strips any leading 0's # of the resulting hex digit pairs, resulting in a different # passphrase being returned. encoded_key = array.array('B', key).tolist() return ''.join(hex(x).replace('0x', '') for x in encoded_key) try: self._open_volume(passphrase, **kwargs) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: if e.exit_code == 2: # NOTE(lyarwood): Workaround bug#1633518 by attempting to use # a mangled passphrase to open the device.. LOG.info(_LI("Unable to open %s with the current passphrase, " "attempting to use a mangled passphrase to open " "the volume."), self.dev_path) self._open_volume(self._get_mangled_passphrase(key), **kwargs)

commit_message:
Fix a bug of wait_for_status when running timeout

1.Add attr_id and status_attr args to TimeoutException.
2.Add unittest about waiting timeout.

Change-Id: Ibc5bb795ac1ed4a7ba4d4c7264b7f8d26ab3d404

commit_message:
Cinder consistency group returning generic error message

When trying to create a consistency group with the quota reached
already, the error raised to the user is the generic "ERROR: The
server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested
operation. (HTTP 500)" message.
This patch will make the error message return to the user with
a 413 error code. Such as "ERROR: GroupLimitExceeded: Maximum number
of groups allowed (10) exceeded'.(HTTP 413)"

Change-Id: I0dd86dbc84d3dc75568c39aca8150c8fa12c4811
Closes-Bug: #1610295
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/65/408365/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/65/65/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ValidateTest(base.KeystoneTest): def test_validate(self): """Test that we can validate tokens using Keystone.""" # Issue the validation request resp = self.ks_admin.validate_token(self.admin_tok, self.user_tok) # Verify that resp is correct util.assert_equal(resp.status, 200) util.assert_in('auth', resp.obj) util.assert_in('token', resp.obj['auth']) util.assert_in('expires', resp.obj['auth']['token']) util.assert_equal(resp.obj['auth']['token']['expires'], self.user_expire) util.assert_in('id', resp.obj['auth']['token']) util.assert_equal(resp.obj['auth']['token']['id'], self.user_tok) util.assert_in('user', resp.obj['auth']) util.assert_in('username', resp.obj['auth']['user']) util.assert_equal(resp.obj['auth']['user']['username'], base.options.username)

commit_message:
Add mode and properties to portgroup

This change adds mode and properties (available since ironic API
microversion 1.26) as possible creation attributes for ironic CLI.
OpenStackClient support coming in the next patch.

Partial-Bug: #1618754
Change-Id: I4552f06884c7cf7e66c310c5639e8f3149497105

commit_message:
Fix misleading port delete description

After the fix of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/126309
the pre-existed Neutron port that are attached to the
instance will not be deleted, the current description
is misleading.

Change-Id: Ibfd4bc2278911844e4b1c05e94b4e3c947365b75

added_lines: - Ports attached to the server that are not pre-existed in Neutron are deleted.
deleted_lines: - The port attached to the server is deleted.

commit_message:
Configure tempest for multitenancy/flat network

Configure some tempest settings depending on if running multitenant vs
flat-network.

Add setting of [compute]/fixed_network_name for the flat-network case,
as this is required to run tempest "smoke" test.

Starting with the Newton release, multitenancy is available with
Ironic. This patch sets tempest auth.create_isolated_networks=False and
network.shared_physical_network=True only when Ironic is deployed for
a flat-network.

Partial-Bug: #1646640
Change-Id: I9807014b739b7364502d403e7ce72763f5ea698a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/76/406376/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG compute fixed_network_name $PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME

commit_message:
Pull in docutils restriction so docs build

0.13.1 is busted and is causing the gate to die so
ensure we restrict the version so that the gate doesn't
die.

commit_message:
Add user and project support in action  parse

action-show can't show user and project, this patch
adds in server side.
Other patches will follow up.

Change-Id: Iaef6c3a6dcb2ae688669d736f1850112d9916faa
Closes-Bug: #1652423

commit_message:
Removes unnecessary utf-8 encoding

The following file(s) added utf-8 encoding but never used. So we can
remove them at all.

os_brick/tests/base.py
os_brick/tests/remotefs/test_remotefs.py
os_brick/tests/test_brick.py

Change-Id: Icf7275285e2024fbfd577e95a5d88a50734858bb

commit_message:
Replace assertDictMatch with assertDictEqual

assertDictMatch was introduced for Python 2.6 only. Python 2.7+
contains assertDictEqual.

Change-Id: I4914981029995a28cffa8b39e8757f77890a3c2b
Closes-bug: #1646433

commit_message:
Xenserver patch

As OpenStack + XenServer deployment is not that common as KVM. This
patch contains class parameter update to allow configure
OpenStack with XenServer more easily.

Deployment guides for OpenStack + XenServer can be found here:

https://www.citrix.com/blogs/2015/11/30/integrating-xenserver-rdo-and-neutron/
http://openstack-xenserver.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

Change-Id: I3e316f36527f50745e2b29040f856423ccd1af45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/68/413668/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*ovs_integration_bridge*] # (optional) Name of Open vSwitch bridge to use # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $ovs_integration_bridge = $::os_service_default, 'DEFAULT/ovs_integration_bridge': value => $ovs_integration_bridge;

commit_message:
Remove deadcode about request_context

This patch removes deadcode about request_context.

Change-Id: I6b9daaab0f7fbfc2f0c362378a597f4fe3198201
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/16/414516/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def request_context(func): @functools.wraps(func) def wrapped(self, ctx, *args, **kwargs): if ctx is not None and not isinstance(ctx, senlin_context.RequestContext): ctx = senlin_context.RequestContext.from_dict(ctx.to_dict()) try: return func(self, ctx, *args, **kwargs) except exception.SenlinException: raise oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.ExpectedException() return wrapped

added_lines: function post_test_hook {{ # NOTE(stevemar): After the newton release was tagged the file was moved. # But, we run functional tests for various stable releases # (mitaka, and newton). # TODO(stevemar): Remove this check when Newton is EOL'ed. hook_location=$BASE/new/python-openstackclient/openstackclient/tests/functional/post_test_hook.sh if [ ! -f "$hook_location" ]; then hook_location=$BASE/new/python-openstackclient/openstackclient/post_test_hook.sh fi

subject: Fix VMAX unit test timeout issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 01:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/emc/test_emc_vmax.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/b6b41d449c703c28aee43f1feb4609b4267ac9cd', 'message': 'Fix VMAX unit test timeout issue

The unit test test_delete_volume_fast_success timed out because
it is doing 60 retries of 10 sec intervals. This patch set
the number of retries and interval to 0 in the test. Before this
fix, this unit test hung on my setup. After this fix, this unit
test finished in 3 secs and the total of 297 VMAX unit tests
finished in 11 secs on my setup.

Change-Id: I4edfff4c3127623998f251ff014c6f3c11bce4b2
Closes-Bug: #1651615
'}]
commit_message:
Fix VMAX unit test timeout issue

The unit test test_delete_volume_fast_success timed out because
it is doing 60 retries of 10 sec intervals. This patch set
the number of retries and interval to 0 in the test. Before this
fix, this unit test hung on my setup. After this fix, this unit
test finished in 3 secs and the total of 297 VMAX unit tests
finished in 11 secs on my setup.

Change-Id: I4edfff4c3127623998f251ff014c6f3c11bce4b2
Closes-Bug: #1651615
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/12/413312/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: emc_vmax_utils.JOB_RETRIES = 0 emc_vmax_utils.INTERVAL_10_SEC = 0 # Set JOB_RETRIES and INTERVAL_10_SEC to 0 to avoid timeout self.assertEqual(0, self.assertEqual(0, # Set JOB_RETRIES 0 to avoid timeout self.assertEqual(0, # Set INTERVAL_10_SEC to 0 to avoid timeout self.assertEqual(0,

Add profile_type_ops RPC call

This adds a RPC call that lists the operations supported by a specified
profile type.

commit_message:
Fix `openstack  cluster policy show` bug

This patch fixes project_id and user_id show bug in
command `openstack  cluster policy show`.

Change-Id: I4f2bad581b9ac56beb8bfd0e3ab2750701459e6d
Depends-On:If088bf2e606b6bd74e520ff11b9ad2e1d97f5773
Closes-Bug:#1650120
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/22/411122/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: policy = self.mock_client.get_policy('sp001') self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['created_at'], policy.created_at) self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['data'], policy.data) self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['id'], policy.id) self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['name'], policy.name) self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['project'], policy.project_id) self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['spec'], policy.spec) self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['type'], policy.type) self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['updated_at'], policy.updated_at) self.assertEqual(self.response['policy']['user'], policy.user_id)

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

To be co-installable with other OpenStack projects and have consistent
testing it's a good idea (tm) to use constraints when creating tox
environments.

Change-Id: Ifc3469ad67940bdf426bf672d70b6f0e33d5d61c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor-dashboard refs/changes/85/413285/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Trivial: Revise the parameter name of event_get2

This patch revises the name of parameter context in event_get2,
to keep consist with the parameter description.

Change-Id: I245dc5ec6e796825840929f4812da07566f3ab1a

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 02:29:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d1f6f12677ab7ea3fa038fdeecb3ae86cfd3a11b', 'message': 'WIP: Migrate consistency groups to groups

This is the fouth patch that implements the generic-volume-group
bluerpint. It starts to migrate data from consistencygroups to
groups and from cgsnapshots to group_snapshots. This is phase 1
of the migration in support of rolling upgrade.

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-04 21:51:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3d5429eb8fa9a84b850b026239c15ad69ca63f40', 'message': 'WIP: Migrate consistency groups to groups

Change-Id: I1cf31e4ba4acffe08e2c09cbfd5b50cf0ea7a6e0
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-06 20:06:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e58e034632b33298129b1581c03d0e33f7e03db0', 'message': "WIP: Migrate consistency groups to groups

This is the fouth patch that implements the generic-volume-group
bluerpint. It starts to migrate data from consistencygroups to
groups and from cgsnapshots to group_snapshots. This is phase 1
of the migration in support of rolling upgrade.

In the migration script, it creates a default_cgsnapshot_type
for migrating data and copies data from consistency groups to
groups and from cgsnapshots to group_snapshots.

In Newton, write will happen in both old and new tables and
read will happen in the old tables when using consistency
groups APIs.

When creating a consistency group, an entry will be created in
the groups table as well. Similarly updating or deleting a
consistency group will result in updating or deleting the
equivalent entry in the groups table. Similar updates will
happen when a volume is added to or removed from a
consistency group. Similarly this will apply to cgsnapshots.

When creating a group, if {'consistencygroup_support':
'<is> True'} is set in the group type, an equivalent entry
will be created in the consistency groups table. This applies
to other write operations such as update and delete as well.
This is to make sure both new and old APIs will work properly.

It depends on the third patch that adds group snapshots:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/328052/

Change-Id: I1cf31e4ba4acffe08e2c09cbfd5b50cf0ea7a6e0
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group

'}, {'number': 22, 'created': '2016-11-22 04:52:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/fa4b1b24bea761630af3c029659073e6b4853b4f', 'message': 'Migrate consistency groups to groups

This patch provides script to migrate data from consistencygroups to
groups and from cgsnapshots to group_snapshots.

In the migration script, it creates a default_cgsnapshot_type
for migrating data and copies data from consistency groups to
groups and from cgsnapshots to group_snapshots.

It depends on the following patch that adds generic code for
online data migrations:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330391/

Run the following command to migrate CGs:
    cinder-manage db online_data_migrations
    --max_count <max>
    --ignore_state
max_count is optional. Default is 50.
ignore_state is optional. Default is False.

Without running the online_data_migrations script, new operations on
the existing CGs will fail.

After migration, using CG APIs to create/delete/modify a CG will also
create/delete/modify a generic volume group in the DB.

Using generic volume group APIs will only affect the generic volume group DB.

Drivers already supporting CG should add CG functionality to generic volume
groups so that users can start using generic volume groups commands to create
groups supporting CG after migration. Without doing so, users will have to
continue to use the CG commands for CG operations even after migration.

Drivers without existing CG functionality can add CG support to generic
volume groups directly.

For more information on how to add CG support to generic volume groups,
see the following dev doc patch:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393570/

UpgradeImpact
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group
Related: blueprint online-schema-upgrades
Change-Id: I1cf31e4ba4acffe08e2c09cbfd5b50cf0ea7a6e0

commit_message:
Migrate consistency groups to groups

This patch provides script to migrate data from consistencygroups to
groups and from cgsnapshots to group_snapshots.

In the migration script, it creates a default_cgsnapshot_type
for migrating data and copies data from consistency groups to
groups and from cgsnapshots to group_snapshots. Migrated consistency
groups and cgsnapshots will be removed from the database.

It depends on the following patch that adds generic code for
online data migrations:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330391/

Run the following command to migrate CGs:
    cinder-manage db online_data_migrations
    --max_count <max>
    --ignore_state
max_count is optional. Default is 50.
ignore_state is optional. Default is False.

UpgradeImpact
Partial-Implements: blueprint generic-volume-group
Related: blueprint online-schema-upgrades
Change-Id: I1cf31e4ba4acffe08e2c09cbfd5b50cf0ea7a6e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/50/350350/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @require_context def group_volume_type_mapping_get_all_by_group_volume_type(context, group_id, volume_type_id): mappings = _group_volume_type_mapping_get_all_by_group_volume_type( context, group_id, volume_type_id) return mappings # Also create an entry in the groups table group_create(context, values, cg_snap_id, cg_id): # Also update the entry in groups table group_update(context, consistencygroup_id, values) # Also delete the entry in groups table group_destroy(context, consistencygroup_id)

commit_message:
Remove '_get_host_cluster' method from docker profile

This removes the said method because it is not that useful.

Change-Id: I40096031c811f07edfbe57f315a0edb4e17e2708
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/60/412460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(cluster.Cluster, 'load') def test__get_random_node(self, mock_cluster): @mock.patch.object(cluster.Cluster, 'load') def test__get_random_node_cluster_not_found(self, mock_load): mock_load.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='cluster', id='host_cluster') ctx = mock.Mock() profile = docker_profile.DockerProfile('container', self.spec) ex = self.assertRaises(exc.InternalError, profile._get_random_node, ctx, 'host_cluster') msg = _("The host cluster (host_cluster) could not be found.") self.assertEqual(msg, ex.message) @mock.patch.object(cluster.Cluster, 'load') def test__get_random_node_empty_cluster(self, mock_cluster): @mock.patch.object(cluster.Cluster, 'load') def test__get_random_node_no_active_nodes(self, mock_cluster):

commit_message:
Add 'do_validate' to docker profile

This patch adds validation logic to docker profile. The constraint is
that either host_node or host_cluster should be specified, but not both.
The specified node or cluster must be valid.

Change-Id: Ie1f9d1c68d8e626c3ba8b481e1fc8014dfdfaa90

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for all jobs in tox.ini

Openstack infra now supports upper constraints for
all jobs. Updated tox.ini to use upper constraints
for all jobs.

Change-Id: I7d9df75b7f76f5019daae6e9fab30ebea5a7a834

commit_message:
Disable message notification by default

According to current oslo.messaging implementation, the event
notifications that we pump into the message queue will be accumulated
there until someone consumes them. This may lead to a sluggish message
queue if no components have registered to consume senlin notifications.
This patch propose disable the message notifications by default.
Will follow up with a patch describing how to enable it.

Change-Id: I5691af92be6788260eadac6af9cbee8a6f52ffc6

commit_message:
Add latest Fedora Atomic image 20161221

Add latest Fedora Atomic image released 20161221. Additionally:

- Make entry title generic, in future the hope is to provide an update
  automatically for the latest Fedora Atomic build at all times.
- Use the "latest" URL provided for this purpose.
- Still need to use explicit digest link for now.

Change-Id: I498fff5cc1f332091603c1c1c021f4e86d2094d5

commit_message:
Document projects with service VM's

This commit adds a new document that describes how projects that use
service VM's interact with Nova, and the demands they place on Nova. A
link has been added to the index.

Change-Id: I92b9864af430196671a216bba5d8116b7558b091
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/396966/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2016 Tesora, Inc All Rights Reserved. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Projects that use service VM's ============================== Several projects use service VM's, compute instances that are provisioned by the service, and managed by the service. Different projects have different demands on Nova in this regard and this document summarizes these and is a result of a conversation on the ML[1]. List of projects using service VM's ----------------------------------- This is a list of projects using service VM's. - designate - manila - octavia - sahara - trove - zaqar Trove ````` Trove provisions all compute instances via Nova. Guest images for Trove are not a formal deliverable of the project but the project provides guest elements for use with diskimage-builder. These are reference elements and primarily intended for use in the CI, and for development and testing. Configuration files ''''''''''''''''''' When a compute instance is provisioned by Trove, configuration files for the guest instance are created at runtime and injected into the guest instance. The block of code below illustrates the invocation of the server.create API call. Whether to use config_drive or not is defined by a Trove configuration parameter. .. code-block:: python config_drive = CONF.use_nova_server_config_drive server = self.nova_client.servers.create( name, image_id, flavor_id, files=files, volume=volume_ref, security_groups=security_groups, availability_zone=availability_zone, nics=nics, config_drive=config_drive, userdata=userdata, scheduler_hints=scheduler_hints) Upgrade uses Nova server migration '''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''' When upgrading a trove instance, the trove control plane leverages Nova server migration. Related documents ----------------- [1] http://markmail.org/message/5yi2w2mhj7w3d4la

commit_message:
conf: Deprecate more nova-net options

They're multiplying!

Or not. A few nova-net options were removed in I4a6d534c9. Remove some
that we missed, updating the release note in the process.

Note that the 'auto_assign_floating_ip' is only used in the FloatingIP
mixin, which in turn is only used with various nova-network managers.
This means the option is dependent on the 'use_neutron' configuration
option like mostly ever other option in the file. As such, the help text
for that option is updated accordingly.

Change-Id: If396a7b10562e2fa43cdf4b09e4632cc6e57391a
Implements: bp centralize-config-options-ocata

commit_message:
Move image uploads to tarballs.openstack.org

This is part of the effort to remove private infrastructure from
tripleo-ci and use community infrastructure. The biggest change is
uploads are no longer preformed directly with tripleo-ci scripts,
we'll be using a JJB publisher to handle this task.

Change-Id: I08fab441369739e0b1772c7bd99a92a2fb693b0a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/61/350061/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mkdir -p $WORKSPACE/imagesmv $UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2 $WORKSPACE/images dd if=$WORKSPACE/images/$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2 | ssh $SSH_OPTIONS root@${HOST_IP} copyseed $ENV_NUM wget --progress=dot:mega http://tarballs.openstack.org/tripleo-ci/images/ipa_images.tar || true wget --progress=dot:mega http://tarballs.openstack.org/tripleo-ci/images/overcloud-full.tar || true ssh root@$SEED_IP tar -C /home/stack -cf - ironic-python-agent.initramfs ironic-python-agent.vmlinuz ironic-python-agent.kernel > $WORKSPACE/images/ipa_images.tar ssh root@$SEED_IP tar -C /home/stack -cf - overcloud-full.qcow2 overcloud-full.initrd overcloud-full.vmlinuz > $WORKSPACE/images/overcloud-full.tar md5sum overcloud-full.tar > $WORKSPACE/images/overcloud-full.tar.md5 md5sum ipa_images.tar > $WORKSPACE/images/ipa_images.tar.md5 md5sum $TRIPLEO_ROOT/$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2 > $WORKSPACE/images/$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2.md5
deleted_lines: dd if=$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2 | ssh $SSH_OPTIONS root@${HOST_IP} copyseed $ENV_NUM wget --progress=dot:mega http://$MIRRORSERVER/builds/current-tripleo/ipa_images.tar || true wget --progress=dot:mega http://$MIRRORSERVER/builds/current-tripleo/overcloud-full.tar || true ssh root@$SEED_IP tar -C /home/stack -cf - ironic-python-agent.initramfs ironic-python-agent.vmlinuz ironic-python-agent.kernel > ipa_images.tar ssh root@$SEED_IP tar -C /home/stack -cf - overcloud-full.qcow2 overcloud-full.initrd overcloud-full.vmlinuz > overcloud-full.tar md5sum overcloud-full.tar > overcloud-full.tar.md5 md5sum ipa_images.tar > ipa_images.tar.md5 md5sum $TRIPLEO_ROOT/$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2 > $UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2.md5 curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@ipa_images.tar;filename=ipa_images.tar" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@overcloud-full.tar;filename=overcloud-full.tar" # TODO(pabelanger): Remove qcow2 format, since centos-7 cannot mount nbd with the default kernel. curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@$TRIPLEO_ROOT/$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2;filename=$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@$TRIPLEO_ROOT/$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.raw;filename=$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.raw" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@ipa_images.tar.md5;filename=ipa_images.tar.md5" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@overcloud-full.tar.md5;filename=overcloud-full.tar.md5" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "upload=@$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2.md5;filename=$UNDERCLOUD_VM_NAME.qcow2.md5" curl http://$MIRRORSERVER/cgi-bin/upload.cgi -F "repohash=$TRUNKREPOUSED" -F "$JOB_NAME=SUCCESS"

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-tackerclient.

Change-Id: Ibf4801a72637840cc5f908c4938c5d95077ef9d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tackerclient refs/changes/50/413350/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove sriov_agent_required param

This parameter was deprecated in Newton upstream and is being removed in
Ocata.

commit_message:
Use memcache for keystone_authtoken

This change updates where we calculate the memcache server information
to the globals hiera data and updates all the openstack services to
use the heira memcached_servers key for consistency. Additionally all
api services have been updated to configure the memcached servers for
the keystone_authtoken middleware configuration to improve the
responsiveness of the service.

Change-Id: Id1034e22d79c3ea6b25575d9bcf8e8750a02365d
Closes-Bug: #1597512
(cherry picked from commit df416f53d2dcb21c700802f5c2602d19f6d6c70c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/86/395486/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <% globals.store "memcached_port", @memcached_port -%> <% globals.store "memcached_servers", @memcached_servers -%>

commit_message:
Activate nova image preallocation mode

Image preallocation allows storage to be fully allocated at instance
start. This should significantly improve performance on writes to new
blocks and may even improve I/O performance to prewritten blocks due to
reduced fragmentation.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1651772
Change-Id: I5182766bc3c44359f8d909a6d7edd0d2d2cc2b62
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/71/414071/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # check image preallocation mode preallocate_images = Noop.puppet_function 'pick', nova_hash['preallocate_images'], 'space' should contain_nova_config('DEFAULT/preallocate_images').with_value(preallocate_images)

commit_message:
Activate nova image preallocation mode

Image preallocation allows storage to be fully allocated at instance
start. This should significantly improve performance on writes to new
blocks and may even improve I/O performance to prewritten blocks due to
reduced fragmentation.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1651772
Change-Id: I5182766bc3c44359f8d909a6d7edd0d2d2cc2b62
Depends-On: I1be99c9af8f32b1a7f8408ddeb695fd05a603ace
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/55/413055/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: preallocate_images = Noop.puppet_function 'pick', nova_hash['preallocate_images'], 'space' 'libvirt_virt_type' => libvirt_type, 'vncserver_listen' => '0.0.0.0', 'preallocate_images' => preallocate_images,

commit_message:
Standardize vals for keystone user creation

This PS goes through the keystone user creation templates and
standardizes the values.

Change-Id: I69406dc2c93f11ba12060e0288d73b2094c25d86
Partially-Implements: blueprint helm-microservices
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/43/414643/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {{- $resourceName := "nova-create-keystone-user" }}{{- $serviceType := "create-keystone-user" }} {{- $elementName := .Values.element_name | default $serviceName }} {{- $elementType := .Values.element_type | $serviceType }}{{- with $env := dict "resourceName" $resourceName "serviceName" $serviceName "serviceType" $serviceType "elementName" $elementName "elementType" $elementType "podTypeBootstrap" $podTypeBootstrap "userName" $userName "userDomain" $userDomain "userProject" $userProject "userProjectDomain" $userProjectDomain "userRole" $userRole "Values" .Values "Release" .Release }}

subject: Clean up mistral
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-23 08:02:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging/commit/ed91e85cfb83194375560342758b1e89da47a66b', 'message': "Clean up mistral

- add license
- fix Summary formatting
- rename -common into main package, because other depend on
py2pkg('mistral') - which resolves to the main package, that does not
exist
- remove %config(noreplace) from systemd unit files. those are supposed
to come from the package, user customisations should be done by

commit_message:
Clean up mistral

- add license
- fix Summary formatting
- rename -common into main package, because other depend on
py2pkg('mistral') - which resolves to the main package, that does not
exist
- remove %config(noreplace) from systemd unit files. those are supposed
to come from the package, user customisations should be done by
overwriting the file in /etc/systemd/...

Change-Id: Id203f022df028ae1d9380df3ca2a660237a5c3e6

commit_message:
Fix container cleanup in test_account_bulk

BulkTests needs to cleanup containers after each tests, and
it tries to so by setting an instance attribute, a list of
containers, and using a class method delete_containers,
which uses a class attribute to discover containers to be
deleted.

Fixing this by making delete_containers a static method
which accepts the list of containers and an input.

Partial-bug: #1650205
Partial-bug: #1609156
Change-Id: I3651c2e06ca52b64e43e707de9af7d45062629bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/87/411887/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_containers(self): # NOTE(andreaf) BulkTests needs to cleanup containers after each # test is executed. To achieve that override the delete_containers # from the base class to use self.containers (not cls.containers). container_client = self.container_client object_client = self.object_client base.delete_containers(self.containers, container_client, object_client)

commit_message:
Making all identity service clients as tempest available

Now all identity service clients are in under lib and
we can make all identity service clients as tempest
available one which means register automatically.

Token clients are being instantiated explicitly as
they expect different set of arg.

Change-Id: Ifbf0b9af35e87e7a552659954721f9a431a0f8d9

commit_message:
Add support of remote logging

This change adds option remote_syslog_server, which allows to configure
address of server to which rsyslog will send logs.

Change-Id: I028bf219e2c3fc7aef95f543fbc5c33028bfe2e9

commit_message:
Change "Openstack" to "OpenStack"

According to the word choice convention in
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/word-choice.html
We should use OpenStack instead of Openstack.

Change-Id: I679b1d4aad2e310f661d3bf908191c4246b793a6

commit_message:
Stop accessing advertise_mtu option

It's deprecated since Newton, and will be removed in Ocata.

Since Ocata, neutron will always advertise MTU by means available to it
(DHCPv4 option and IPv6 RA MTU parameter for reference implementation).

Change-Id: I4f4c97b3986fb552c0ec866b08d143efd9155748
Related: I31e15018fe764de0fe4d6de7da3c1d9f2cc1d532

commit_message:
[Dell EMC Unity] Support create share smaller than 3 GB

The minimum file system on Unity is 3 GB. This patch changes
driver to create 3 GB underlying file system for shares
smaller than 3 GB.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ida6ad9ad7e752c25b53390f0fee327c594e03f9f
Closes-Bug: 1648316

commit_message:
Add init containers for deps to missing things

This PS goes through the microservices and adds dep init containers
to those missing them.

Partially-Implements: blueprint helm-microservices
Change-Id: I349bddc38b7fe6f78a7466a0a55df930329f19a1

commit_message:
Use call_and_ignore_notfound_exc method

Updating 'clear_snapshots' method for using call_and_ignore_notfound_exc
method, in order to prevent a duplicated code.

Change-Id: Ice75db8634115b5a0bd7a262a3d6e11a626ea939

commit_message:
use unpatched socket module to get addresses

The function os_win._utils.get_ips can fail on some
environments if the socket module is monkey patched by
eventlet. Using the unpatched module fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1652371

Change-Id: Ib145f5b216d39d1e49231522f7d32d1ec2c63272
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/22/414622/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: socket = eventlet.import_patched('socket')

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 04:17:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/e802c7b53c0254fd69aada5b3f45333ad190a6c1', 'message': 'Replace pexpect with processutils in volume.py

In investigating the issues with resize, it was noticed that pexpect is
used throughout guestagent/volume.py. This should be replaced with

handling/reporting.

Closes-Bug: 1651589
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-21 05:56:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/b612b994de64f08858c6ecd7f1c6da32cd05b60d', 'message': 'Replace pexpect with processutils in volume.py

Change-Id: I844dd26a968a50532a6220a0762a302c2cadc2d0
Closes-Bug: 1651589
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-21 23:34:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/13c2d278525591765cf098627f06127c94284cf6', 'message': "Replace pexpect with processutils in volume.py

In investigating the issues with resize, it was noticed that pexpect
is used throughout guestagent/volume.py. These were replaced with
oslo_concurrency.processutils.execute to allow more robust error
handling/reporting.

Certain cases were made more tolerant to unknown states (for
example resize_fs now makes sure the volume is unmounted).
This (hopefully) will fix the intermittent gate issues
plaguing volume-resize lately.

While examining the errors returned from the guest, it was
observed that in one case a fault message from the guest was
almost immediately overwritten by a less-detailed one
from the taskmanager.  Handling was put in place for this
case to only write the fault if the previous fault was 'old'
enough.

The unit tests for volume were cleaned up as well with
regards to proper mocking and checking that the calls
were actually made properly.

Change-Id: I844dd26a968a50532a6220a0762a302c2cadc2d0
Closes-Bug: 1651589
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-22 01:10:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/d689e5c60be266d9da30321b912595ee8243b172', 'message': "Replace pexpect with processutils in volume.py
